The only con I'd say is that it is not the most discreet, however, it is less noisy than your average blender. This blender also acts as a food processor and honestly one of my favorite features. I am Hispanic and I make A LOTTT of SOFRITO! If you know, you know. The blender, although plastic, does not absorb the smell of the contents you put into the blender after each wash. Definitely worth the investment.

Author: J. Love
Title: The worst blender ever
Body: I use a blender everyday. I’ve had many. This is the biggest waste of money for cheap plastic parts and a poorly engineered designed. First, it’s SO loud, which I find ironic given the brand is “ninja.” It’s startling loud, like a second alarm clock, or cold shower in the morning. Second, why does the blade not securely lock into the base? I like all of my breakfast shake, so I turn my blender upside down and let every drop fall into my cup. Since the blade doesn’t lock in, I made a terrible mess, and almost sliced my foot the first time I tried this because the blade just dropped out when I poured my shake out. Third, it takes forever to blend the ice. It does blend the ice, but so has every other blender I’ve owned. This one just takes 3 times as long (and is 4x the price). I make 5 shakes a morning so this has added 5 minutes to my morning routine as it takes about a minute longer for each shake. Finally, why the cheap plastic parts? Again, at 4x the cost of every other blender I’ve owned, I expected high quality materials. My last blender was glass, with a metal base, which was great because it meant it was sturdy, but also easy to clean (in a dishwasher). I was very excited to get this blender as I’ve always wanted a “better” blender (better name brand, professional grade) since I use mine so frequently. Unfortunately, this has not lived up to my expectations at all.

For the last three weeks, I've had major difficulties trying to get the blending lid to sufficiently lock in place. I've tried multiple times, but it rarely works now. I checked to see if the large unit still works, and it does. I'm not sure why this keeps happening, but it is time to look for a replacement. Oh...Regarding noise level, these are loud & so I wear ear protection when making smoothies.

Title: Awesome customer support
Body: My original pitcher arrived with a funky crack going through the bottom. I looked at returning it, but found I could reach out to the manufacturer for the pitcher to be replaced. 5 minutes on the phone later, and a video call so they could see the crack, and they were sending me a replacement. To top it off the replacement was here a lot faster than they said.The blender is amazing. I have used it with just the shakers and the pitcher. It works like a dream. Making protein shakes with chunks/cubes of ice is not a problem. I pop the shakers, all blades, and shaker lids on the top rack of the dishwasher and they come out fine. I hand wash the pitcher and it's lid. I wish I had got this thing 6 months ago when I started drinking protein shakes.

Author: G. Smith
Title: Cheap plastic, even worse customer service
Body: The black plastic handle disconnected from the plastic pitcher, making the entire unit inoperable because the lid can no longer seal. This happened about after having the unit for 8 months, with limited use. No way to do a warranty claim on website, so called customer service number. Was told wait time would be 10 or 20 minutes, but instead it was 70 min with repetitive “your call is important” recordings just to add a bit of torture for their customers.Reached a helpful agent in the Philippines, but after about 2 min of talking her voice became garbled. This happened 3 times and each time she had to reboot her computer. After explaining it was the pitcher at the beginning of the call and showing the defect on camera, she tells me at the end that “pitchers are not covered under warranty”. Wish she had told me this at the beginning and saved me the additional 30 min of wasted time. With the cheap materials and design of the pitcher and lid, I imagine this is probably what breaks the most, so makes sense financially for them to not cover it, but not so good for their customers.Anyway, I was placed on hold a few more times and offered a “discounted” replacement for $32. I declined as I assume it will break again and I’m really not eager to give Ninja/Shark anymore of my money. Will buy a new blender from a competition and hope for better quality.

Author: Lee
Title: Fragile irreplaceable pitcher
Body: It works great, use it for smoothies every day, powerful enough to blend ice and frozen fruit. Only problem is the pitcher isn’t very durable. Dropped it once and chipped off one of the corners. No problem, it still worked fine. Now, after having it for a few years, there are small cracks in the pitcher, and it leaks a little bit. Meanwhile, we still have a blender with a glass pitcher that we’ve had since I was a kid (in 40) that still works fine. They don’t make things like they used to, I guess. Replacement pitchers apparently cost more than the entire blender, which…I’m no economist, but I don’t understand how cheap plastic can cost MORE than exactly the same cheap plastic + a powerful blender base. Given how fragile it is, and since if it breaks, you might as well replace the whole thing… I’ll keep using it and maybe repair the cracks, but when it’s time for a new one, in think I’ll go with a different brand.

Title: Great blender...buuut they have quality control issues.
Body: I really wanted to love this blender and in terms of use and power I think it's great! Having said that, the first blender I ordered had hairline cracks in the bottom and around the imbedded gear that turns the blade of the pitcher and while it worked eventually the cracks would get worse. I returned this first blender and got a replacement but the pitcher on the replacement had almost the same cracks so this got sent back too. The damage to each pitcher looked as if the bottoms were compressed up causing stress fractures. Since the boxes of both blenders were undamaged and the inside packing appeared robust I would guess that there is a quality control issue. Disappointing too as I liked this blender otherwise.

Author: Alexi
Title: sturdy with power
Body: Huge difference from using a regular blender!

Author: David
Title: So far so good
Body: Nice blender. Waited to review after several uses. So far so good. Kind of a pain to twist the top off occasionally. The smoothie cups do very well. Overall, solid buy for the $.

Author: Altan Kellar
Title: Ninja BL660 good blender
Body: Great blender! I put things in it and it blends them up real well. We use the single serving cups for smoothies on the go a lot. The blender does us good 👍

Author: The Explorographer
Title: Pitcher problem.
Body: Well, everything seems good. I have had it 1 day so asking for a review is a bit pushy I think. The pitcher looks repaired? The way the drive coupling in the bottom of the pitcher does not look newly manufactured. It honestly looks like someone epoxied it back in after it was broken. It doesn't leak but it certainly does not look like it is new either. There appears to be cracks all around the mount.

Author: kenneth kirby
Title: Great for frappuccinos
Body: I bought this for our daughter who loves to make her own frappuccinos. Our old blender technically still works but it was about 20 years old and she was constantly having to open it up and push down the ingredients so that they would blend. This thing is so unbelievably fast that she can literally pour all the ingredients in and within 10 seconds be done. She's 18 now so whenever she moves out she's obviously taking it with her

Author: Jorge gerez
Title: Amazing
Body: Love this !!!!

Author: paul judd
Title: Didn't last long
Body: Worked great for 6 months

Title: The Blender has some cracks
Body:
The media could not be loaded.

Author: Nichole English
Title: Perfect snow ice!
Body: It’s perfect! It crushed my ice into snow no problem , and my ice chunks were pretty thick!

Author: EJK
Title: Great blender
Body: Love using both full-size blending and single serve blending. Does a great job cutting through ice and frozen fruits quickly to deliver a smooth smoothie. Also the 2 travel cups are a huge bonus.

Author: Nathan Schwartz
Title: Works great, disappointed to go cups have holes in lids
Body: We purchased the blender with the two personal cups with lids thinking these would be good to take with us to work, however the lids have drinking holes, so not a tually practical for our needs as cyclists. Would be fine for someone driving to work in a car. Easy to use otherwise, powerful, easy to clean.

Author: Lety
Title: En un principio llego rota. Pero pedi el reemplazo la mandaro de nuevo. no me siento estafada.
Body: Tiene un poder de mezclado excepcional. Y muy facil de limpiar. Estoy feliz con mi nueva ninja

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love a NINJA
Body: Does exactly what I need to make my protein shakes! Great Product!

Author: Ali
Title: Cheap material
Body: Used it about 10 times before a plastic piece in the pitcher broke which stop the entire blender from working. Cheap.

Author: David Swanson
Title: Great product!
Body: My husband and I have been making smoothies all weekend long. Easy to use and to clean!

Author: Jaime R.
Title: Potente
Body: Muy buena y potente

Author: Sergio gonzlez
Title: Very cool
Body: Nice

Author: An user
Title: Really good, best blender I have had and seen.
Body: All good

Author: Fabian
Title: Perfect
Body: Perfect

Author: Jim Stolze
Title: Awesome item!
Body: My husband got this for me for Christmas. I got to use it today and it’s amazing!

Author: Ivan Helou
Title: Nice
Body: Good

Author: Sister Olivia
Title: It’s so powerful!!
Body: I’ve tried it a few times to see it was up to par….. Its powerful, it’s easy to assemble. Makes delicious smoothies in a matter of seconds! Very easy to clean. Do not hesitate to buy this blender.

Author: Greene's
Title: Works great but noisy
Body: Does a great job with everything I put in it. It's fairly loud when operating, I reckon that's the nature of the beast with most blenders. I love that the blades are removeable, makes cleaning a breeze.

Author: uriel
Title: Buen producto
Body: Es muy fácil de limpiar

Author: Robert V.
Title: Love!
Body: Great overall blender! I use it for so much, very versatile and sturdy. This now my second one as I lost my first one in a move. Highly recommend.

Author: Carolina Hernandez
Title: Exactly what I was looking for!
Body: It is perfect! Just what I wanted and more.

Author: Bionca
Title: A must have!
Body: I absolutely love this blender this is the best one I have ever had. I highly recommend this product.

Author: J. Call
Title: Price dropped, bought and got a defective one.
Body: It runs like the motor is too strong for itself. It is extremely louder than my other Ninja (that we had 10 years and repaired 3 times). I think when the price is lower, we get defective items that just didn't pass the test well enough to charge full-price.

Author: Celestine Brandon
Title: Excellent Buy
Body: Great size, nice blending power, great price.

Author: Melanie Battershell
Title: Blender is amazing
Body: This is used for blending frozen fruit for a smoothie

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Ninja
Body: Great blender

Author: Hugobert Charles Fils
Title: Amazing blender
Body: Great product from ninja.

Author: Leola Halferty
Title: Love it
Body: Love it really needed it for my cold coffee drinks

Author: beadr
Title: Powerful and good, with important caveats
Body: We have enjoyed our Ninja with a couple of caveats: Blades aren't low enough to blend smaller amounts, although this model comes with single service options. Not enough speeds- even on 1 (of 3) when you open the spout to add as you mix, liquid flies out. Very Loud. Too many safety features- pegs that push in and tabs that snap and lock, all of these are failing after only 4 years, so now my blender is stuck shut and I have to smack, punch, yank, pull to get it open every time. Unless it just opens as it should, which it does sometimes. Also, you cannot get a new carafe and lid except for about $10 cheaper than the new one. Used is an option, but be careful, they made a few different designs of base to carafe connection and they don't fit together if you don't get just the right model number. All in all, I'll buy a different brand next time.

Author: SandraA
Title: Too big and too small - do not recommend
Body: This does not fit under standard height cupboards. Why did no reviewer mention that? Would have been SO easy for them to make this a couple inches shorter! Takes up way too much room. And the single serve cups are TINY! Why make them so small! ? Such bad design choices. Unless you are running a restaurant the overall footprint is way too big. I deeply regret buying this (and waiting too long to use it so I can't send it back.)

Author: Roberto
Title: Me Gusto Mucho Gracias
Body: Yego Bien Gracias

Author: Katherine F.
Title: Amazing appliance
Body: Worked great for making protein smoothies and fresh applesauce can't wait to do more!

Author: Greg Clinebell
Title: Be careful
Body: Was shipped a used blender in beat up packaging....now I am scrambling to replace as a Christmas Gift.

Author: Juan M.
Title: Potente y practica
Body: Su potencia de mezclar

Author: Marivel Hernandez
Title: Yuk
Body: Not sure why I received a dirty and damaged product in a box of pull upsI have purchased used almost new in the past but never received a product in this condition

Author: Amazonholic
Title: Mixed Thoughts
Body: This is a great product but after a little over a month and the craft is cracking. It's pretty disappointing. I do like it, but rather expensive for this to happen

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: pulverizes ice to snow in seconds excellent for frozen drink and More!
Body: :) I LOVE everything! I bought because it stated pulverizes ice to snow in seconds for a frozen drink. This blender was the only one to have this in description. I never have written a review for Amazon but I was in my orders and was reminded about this blender. I was so impressed on every thing about it - I must write a review. :)

Author: Sandra
Title: Perfecta!.
Body: Me encantó, muy fácil de manejar, el ruido al mezclar es el normal de cualquier licuadora, se fija muy bien y no se mueve, tritura por completo y hablando del vaso para batidos, con la fruta congelada trabaja perfecto y todo lo tritura de maravilla, sin duda lo recomiendo mucho.

Author: Fayy
Title: Very appalled
Body: I was looking forward to trying out this blender but unfortunately it didn’t even make it out of the box. I receive my package and the box was all busted up and just holding together by a piece of tape. I then further examined the contents inside and was even more frustrated. The blender itself had white spots everywhere as if he had just been washed and it also had a crack on the bottom. I don’t believe that this was a new item and rather a return. This is disgusting.

Author: Morrell Parrish
Title: Great product
Body: Great product

Author: Tessa Kaesmeyer
Title: Great blender
Body: Very powerful and seems like great quality.

Author: Zack
Title: Great Blender
Body: I got this blender for my mother for Mother's Day because her old one was not working properly, and she loves it! i've used it multiple times and i love it too, its pretty easy to use and I would recommend it again.

Author: barbara pagan
Title: Still works great
Body: Easy to clean and easy to use

Author: RonS
Title: A good blender at a reasonable price.
Body: Looked at a lot of different blenders and smoothie makers before buying this. This made the most sense as it is a single serving smoothie maker and a blender both! The single serve cup works great for me. Plenty of power to mix up a drink really fast! I haven’t got to the blender yet but I’m sure it will work well. There were a lot of good reviews on this part of the unit.

Author: Isabelle L
Title: Didn’t last long, bad product - not satisfied
Body: Blending power not good,Broken after 1 year warranty expired. In order to replace the part, need to pay $69 plus tax and the $24.95 shipping charge. Too expensive!! Would rather buy another better quality blender with that money

Author: Richard
Title: Awesome bender
Body: I purchased this bender to replaced my old one. This bender is remarkable. I highly recommend this bender to make smoothies and pina colada’s.

Author: Zamira
Title: Good one
Body: It's good for milkshake or smoozy!

Author: Ariel Armada
Title: Buena
Body: En realidad siempre me agradan las licuadoras ninja lastima que amazon te promete una entrega y no lo hace pues pierde el encanto el regalo

Author: Rosario Melo
Title: Muele muy bien
Body: Es buena pero difícil de limpiar

Author: Lauren
Title: Cracks & lid doesn’t stay
Body: I’ve had this blender now for 2 years. The sides have mini cracks and the lid won’t stay on unless you hold it down (which you have to hold while it blends bc otherwise the locking mechanism doesn’t work). Also the lid has fallen off while pouring and the blade falls out which is so dangerous!!

Author: Falk14
Title: Very loud!
Body: I like the product but I wish it wasn't as loud as it is, that it had a little more blending power, and the lid was easier to clean. Ninja is a highly regarded brand and for the price I feel like I got the value I was looking for. This was my first major blender purchase so for my next purchase the items I listed that I didn't like as much I will probably focus on more. If you are just looking for a slightly above average blender that looks good on your counter - this product works for you.

Author: Sherry Rucker
Title: Blends very well but is leaking some.
Body: The hilder for the ingredients is leaking some and is past the return time. Only had it 3 months! Frustrated!

Author: johnmedovarsky
Title: Trash ! Just smoked
Body: Unboxed it . Made protein shake in small cup . Started smoking like crazy and shut off . Unless you just blend water . Stay away no power

Author: John N
Title: Gets it done
Body: I make frozen drinks and it does a great job. It feels more like a professional blender.

Author: Jordan M.
Title: Best Blender For Everyday Use
Body: Purchased this blender specifically to make protein shakes, and I have used it every day for the past 2 years! It works great and has yet to have any issues! I would highly recommend this product.

Author: Melissa&Jason
Title: Works well, but the pitcher is already cracked
Body: Purchased in May 2022, by September the pitcher had developed cracks along the bottom. I use it once every week or two to make smoothies, store it in a cabinet upright and dry, and have never dropped it or anything like that.This is my 2nd Ninja product, and both have had similar problems. The plastic on my Ninja coffee maker carafe came apart after a few months, too, and in both cases Ninja said it's not covered by warranty as they are wearable parts. I washed the carafe on the top rack as recommended, and the pitcher for this blender on the bottom rack as recommended, with my water heater set at 120F (so not unusually hot).The blender is still functional, which is why I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1. It just leaks. And a replacement pitcher costs almost as much as a whole new blender!I expected better quality for the price.

Author: Anthony Suda
Title: Cracked after 2 days - replacement pitcher did the same
Body: Only looked at the total star rating - I should’ve looked at the photo reviews too.Cracked almost immediately - within days. Getting a replacement from the company seems like it won’t fix the design flaw based on all the hundreds of other reviews.Update- called ninja. The pitcher is “an accessory” and not covered by any warranty. But as others stated in reviews they “graciously” sent a replacement this one time.That one cracked in the same exact way within days. And yes we quick pulse before just letting it loose to chop ice as the manual states.Obvious design flaw.

Author: Gene D. Smith
Title: Great blender
Body: Simple to use and easy to clean. Powerful motor makes blending easy and fast. Recommend this appliance.

Author: RedSquadron
Title: As expected.
Body: Great product

Author: robert
Title: Great product for the price
Body: This a great product my daughter ordered this for making smoothies & chopping up food. I would highly recommend.

Author: TerryFLL
Title: Shady warranty.
Body: After less than 6 uses the single serving blade stopped working....so I called product support. I was told they warranty the power unit and not the attachments, if you can believe it, and the replacement part would be $26.95 plus S&H. I said you have got to be kidding me and was then quickly offered a 50% discount. I said not acceptable and after a brief hold was told they would send the replacement part for free. Just plain silly....wasting 45 minutes of my time. Imagine how impressed I would have been if they just said under warranty, no problem, we'll send a replacement rather than playing lets make a deal.

Author: Trent Hailey
Title: They don't make them like they used to.
Body: Initially I liked this blender pretty well. Used it mostly blending ice making and mixing drinks. Had maybe 20-30 uses and now it doesn't work at all. Won't power on or do anything. Very disappointed in the quality. I expected a longer life out of it. Probably will never buy another Ninja product.

Author: Switchback
Title: Powerful blender
Body: Love it. Super fast and I love just attaching my little smoothie plastic container up to blend the smoothie and I’m on the go!

Author: J.R.
Title: Malfuncitoned after 6 months
Body: This product was only used about 10 times over 6 months. The container locking mechanism broke. Unable to use. Waste of money. Sold by Amazon LLC. Very disappointing.

Author: Dmn6355
Title: Defective lid
Body: Bought my mother one of these many years ago and she loves it and makes the best smoothies. After our glass blender broke last week we decided to give this a try. It arrived and I couldn’t even get the lid off of it the release button would not release. So we returned it… not much good to us if we can’t even get it open consistently. Again maybe just a bad unit? As my mom loves her old one or maybe they changed something either way for the price not a battle I am interested in.

Author: Erin Gunderson
Title: 2nd one
Body: I love this blender so much I have two of them. I purchased this second one for my other property so I have one in each house.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Thoroughly Enjoying This Machine! Highly Recommend!
Body: Product is solid; instructions and idea book are terrific. For me it is affordable as a gift, although I've kept for myself. If you are looking for something for creating healthy smoothies, I would definitely purchase this, and I hope you will.

Author: T-Kay
Title: Stopped working now
Body: I have been forced to review my previous review due to the fact that the unit cannot do smoothie apart from just chopping.....I think Ninja should pull this particular unit from shops. It may destroy their brand loyalty.This is my 3rd Ninja product. Delivers as it promises in terms of quality of material. The complain as others have said already with this one is the noise. I can't stand by it when using it! Unbearable noise.Except the small cap, you can't get smooth puree with the main blade.Ninja. Please do something about the noise!!! It is just too bad.Big blade too sharp. Never play with it. Cleaning is a bit difficult because you can't clean the main blender without removing the blade from inside. Then you need to be extremely careful when taking the blade out. I have already got 2 cuts (accidentally)

Author: John-Paul
Title: Fantastic but loud
Body: This has been amazing. I have been making so many smoothies because of this thing and it works soooo well. It is a bit loud though so I wouldn't recommend using this is someone is asleep nearby.

Author: Wendy Warbington
Title: Stopped working after 1 year
Body: This blender only lasted for a year. Now it barely spins. I called Ninja customer support and they said all they can tell me is to buy a new one. I don’t think you should have to replace a blender every single year. It should last longer than a year. My grandmother’s blender when I was a kid was from the 70’s and it still worked in the 90’s. This is not okay to only be usable for a year. I do not recommend.

Author: Helen O.
Title: started smoking
Body: Have had the product less than 2 years and it started smoking when I used it.

Author: Scott Greenwald
Title: Works great for chopping
Body: Great for smoothies. I’m choppin’ broccoli like no one’s business.

Author: Zee P
Title: This product was exactly what I wanted. Love it
Body: This product was exactly what I wanted. Love it

Author: Emily Dolton
Title: A BEAST of a blender
Body: Forget the small bullet blender! My kid's obsession with acai bowls killed about 4 blenders, but this blender rips through whatever chunky madness you throw in it. Using it is not as straightforward as a typical blender (the top must be facing a certain way, there is a multi-step process for use) but it really blends super well and I rarely have gobs of unblended peanut butter or dry protein powder on the sides. This was a great buy.

Author: Catherine
Title: Love it
Body: Best blender ever. Smoothies, salsas, dips anything this blender is amazing.

Author: Maria J.
Title: Just ok
Body: Real loud doses not cut up all the vegetables some times

Author: christopher
Title: Beware the pitcher
Body: Did ice pretty okay for margaritas. Now though theres a small hairline crack along the bottom of the pitcher that wasnt there before using. Shouldnt advertise for ice if its gonna make the thing crack even with liquid added.

Author: Elise Riesenweber
Title: Everything its promised to be!
Body: Actually blends ice to make slushies and smoothies! Its worth the money

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: NOT dishwasher safe
Body: I've had mine for 2 years now and always use the single-serve cups. I recently used the larger blender, put it in the dishwasher to clean and it came out completely warped so the lid does not fit on making it unusable. Product us advertised as dishwasher safe; what happened?Product blends very well, though, and I've never had a problem with the single serve cups & lids. Shame that the main blender is poor quality for the price.

Author: Cameron
Title: Do not buy open box
Body: I bought this blender with the open box option. It was clearly used and dirty. The plug and blender base were sticky & dirty and the blender did not work. This model of blender might be ok but NINJA needs to stop offering the open box option because this was gross

Author: Stacey corrick
Title: Amazing blender
Body: This thing will blend up anything, and quick. Smoothies are wonderful and the salsa was amazing as well.

Author: Benjamin Paulsen
Title: Wont turn out and all troubleshooting doesn’t work.
Body: I spent about four hours trying to get the thing to even turn out, read articles about why the ninja may not be working, and all to no avail.

Author: tonisha
Title: First ninja owner
Body: I absolutely love this blender for everything smoothies, margaritas great product no issues at all

Author: Tammy Arrowood
Title: Ninja
Body: Great

Author: Erika Amescua
Title: Me encanta
Body: Llevaba tiempo buscando una licuadora que licué bien cada alimento y que sea fácil de lavar. Esta licuadora ha sido muy buena inversión y me encanta.

Author: maria
Title: La mejor inversión que he realizado
Body: Puedo hacer mis bebidas vegetales, licuados y lo mejor de todo es que trae un vaso más pequeño para cuando no quiero ensuciar mucho

Author: Christian
Title: I love this blender
Body: I love making my smoothies and Ice cream in this blender. I just got it so I haven’t made anything else with it, but when I do I’ll write a next review.

Author: Majo Zavala
Title: There is an issue with the pitcher
Body: This is my second ninja blender. I love the power of these blenders. I have to buy this model because the pitcher base of my first blender (It lasted for 5 years) cracked completely. Now, after only 7 months, the new pitcher started cracking. I contacted support and they told me to buy a new pitcher (no warranty on this part). Also, as you can see in the picture, it has a round groove which is really difficult to clean.

Author: Critical Reviewer
Title: Been using this every day for almost 3 years
Body: I make a smoothie for two in it. Two bananas, lots of frozen berries, mangoes, etc... And various powders. I fill it with water all the way to max fill line, and then blend with the three different power settings. It works great. Can't say enough good things about this blender. I love Ninja products.Also, it's fairly easy to clean, but make sure you're always washing the top cover and letting it dry. I haven't done that for 2 years, and there's already mold growing in the silicone gaskets.

Author: Greg Williams
Title: Great personal blender
Body: The personal blender cups work great, I’ve used them almost every day for about two months with no problems at all. The only downsides to it in my opinion are that the personal cups can be hard to hand wash due to their narrowness but come out fine in the dishwasher. The noise level is a bit high for late night blending (I do more of this than I probably should) but what do you expect from a blender I guess. Would recommend it though, great purchase.

Author: Luis Vazquez
Title: One of the best blenders I've ever used.
Body: Great blender, easy to use

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Excellent Quality and Affordable!
Body: This blender is top notch and whips up smoothies in seconds! Great purchase!

Author: Eden
Title: Power!
Body: This is our first powerful blender. Previously, we have purchased cheaper blenders from the local stores. This one performs the others on a completely different scale. Having three level blades is a game changer. His blender is extremely easy to clean and hardly needs to be used above level one power rating. Highly recommend to our friends.

Author: Nyasia Cupid
Title: Only came with one cup
Body: It only came with one cup and it says it comes with two other than that it was amazing

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Nice machine.
Body: Nice machine much better than the bullet mixer.

Author: Yolianser
Title: La seguridad en la que queda el vaso y su gran fuerza.
Body: Todo me gusto, pero aún tengo problema para dejarla impecable después de su uso hay que tener cuidado, pero el equipo me parecio fácil de usar y su potencia es lo que necesito.

Author: Derek Boehm
Title: Awesome!
Body: This works great and blenders everything pretty quickly! Easy to clear and switch between containers it comes with.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: It does not work
Body: Does not work

Author: Don
Title: Freaking awesome!
Body: Will never use another brand!

Author: kimberly gerrry
Title: Amazing! Dependable. And it make ms one fast smoothie!!
Body: Healthy, gain weight for one, loses weight for another. We are using it on the daily❤️

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Replaced the one i had for several years
Body: Old one broke & was happy to be able to find the same one to replace it. No need to buy additional new cups 😌

Author: Doug PAtterson
Title: Absolute junk
Body: Worked great, until the plastic cracked and leaked. We got 10 uses it of it. Find a glass blender, Ninja is trash

Author: Larry Yonally
Title: Super smoothie maker
Body: It’s quiet and quick, good for the price too !

Author: William jones jr
Title: Motor power
Body: Sent to friend for 25 th anniversary and re needed marriage as a gift. Has no problems with it and says blends to most powerful than their old blender that got burned and smoked. This one blends lots of ice and does secound s without a hint of motor burnout!

Author: Susan J.
Title: Love it
Body: Works like a charm

Author: Tee Lee
Title: Greatest I have every used so far. Worth the price!!!
Body: Love it

Author: Michael Venetis
Title: Love the individual cups!
Body: I’ve had a $500 Vitamix, and I like this one more, at a forth of the price. Kids and I mainly use the individual serving cups, which make it quick and easy to make protein shakes and clean up after.

Author: SydRose
Title: This makes other blenders seem inferior.
Body: I drink a lot of fruit smoothies/ protein drinks. I was tired of wrestling with my old, crappy drug store blender just to have my dinner so coughed up the extra money to buy the ninja. This blender took 5 seconds to completely blend my smoothies, it used to take like 2 minutes with my old blender. Even better, the ninja has a bigger blender head to mass produce my smoothies for meal prep. I don’t think I’ll look at another kitchen appliance the same. Every ninja product makes me feel like a caveman when I think back to how I used to make food. It’s definitely worth the investment if you drink a lot of your meals.

Author: readomaniac
Title: This blender is a beast
Body: This blender will not disappoint. It is a beast and will blend anything

Author: Farryn Madd
Title: Love This
Body: This is one of the greatest blenders I have ever purchased especially for my small business. This is a perfect blender.

Author: D. Wagner
Title: Makes a great Smoothie. So easy!
Body: Makes a great Smoothie. So easy!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Strong and powerful
Body: Really enjoy this product. It’s been great for my daily smoothies.

Author: Rhina
Title: Suena mucho
Body: Es muy potente y hermosa, pero suena muchísimo en comparación con la Kitchenaid. Y es un poco fastidioso para lavar la cuchilla.

Author: PILAR QUESADA
Title: Excelente
Body: Más de 1 año de uso y sigue funcionando excelentemente

Author: Gisela Felicie
Title: Licuadora muy util
Body: Me encanta tiene mucha fuerza aunque lo que le va ya a echar esté congelado ella lo tritura es muy buena

Author: Sg19
Title: Powerful but single serve button no longer works
Body: Super powerful. In fact be careful with the blades when washing by hand (they are super sharp and have had close calls with cutting my hand). I like the blender and worked great for my daily smoothies but the single serve button no longer works (bought it close to a month ago).

Author: Solomon
Title: Beat I’ve ever purchased
Body: Absolutely the best blender. Fast, good power and you can almost put anything in there.

Author: Clemente Alfredo Romero Fernandez
Title: Todo excelente
Body: Todo excelente

Author: Luis Almeida
Title: This blender was built to last
Body: As I blended another protein shake with frozen fruit I asked myself how long have I been using and abusing this poor blender. This fine machine has been serving my household since April of 2014 and has been working the same way just like the first day. I had to replace two cups and two cup blades over this period, but that was expected with so much wear and tear. Hope to get many more years of use out of it.

Author: Oliver
Title: Good idea but detective design
Body: Good idea but detective designThe stick with blade has a hole to connect to the motor. The hole will full of mixture wile working which is disgusting and difficult to clean.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Excelente
Body: Excelente

Author: Grecia hurtado
Title: La amo
Body: Es excelente, me encanta

Author: j.m. barnard
Title: Too sharp
Body: Blades to sharp...keep cutting my self

Author: Hector romano
Title: Tiene tanta fuerza que quiere salir corriendo
Body: Esta potente licuadora es tan potente que no tienes que usarla al máximo nivel

Author: Omniscient
Title: Lasted for less 6 months - Company refused to honor warranty
Body: Had high hopes and bought this blender for around $110. It worked well for around 6 months. After that on one fine day, when used the crushing pitcher to make a smoothie, it leaked liquid all over my kitchen. Although the plastic bottle was alright, the crushing pitcher where the blade resides had some issue. I contacted the company Ninja over the call so they can honor their warranty and replace the faulty part. They flatly refused saying only the motor is covered and you would have to pay the list price for a new one. Disappointed to buy Ninja and disappointed with the customer service. As a customer, I appreciate if the company owes up to their defective product and makes it right.NO NOT BUY NINJA - ONLY LAST FEW MONTHS.

After researching, bought this....does a great job. A little heavy for me and larger then I had wanted. Still like it and will use for many years hopefully to make my morning Protein drinks.

Author: JV
Title: This Is My Review
Body: This is my review so I can come back later to update it. I've only had it for a day and it's the second blender I've ever owned in my adult life so do with my review what you will. The first one was some glass kind from Target that was really cheap but that thing lasted for ten years. This Ninja was purchased because my toddler is in love with smoothies. There are two things that I don't like about this so far, but not deal breakers: 1. We aren't too excited about a plastic canister but at the same time, it's probably better with a kid who likes to visit all of our appliances every day and 2. It is a very tall appliance, but we have a lot of space between our counters and cabinets thank goodness. That being said, it was easy to figure out right out of the box and it was very easy to clean afterwards. Turning on the power button and selecting a blend feature this morning scared the you know what out of me and my toddler. We weren't prepared for the type of power this thing puts out. If you haven't had your morning coffee yet and need to wake up, this'll do.

Author: Elizabeth
Title: Pitcher blade wrong choice for smoothies
Body: Product is not designed for smoothies made with ice. The blade on the pitcher does not have a cyclonic blade (a blade that makes a cyclone and a vortex to do its work) and leaves ice in granular condition. This is intentional, as it is designed for other jobs. The small 16 oz. cups that come with this are equipped with a cyclonic blade and will make smooth smoothies - no grains. I have to blend 32 ounces in the pitcher and then use the 16 ounce one to get rid of the granularity. Once I figured this problem out - thanks to some serious blender experts on reviews - I tested it, and there is no doubt. You can blend forever in the pitcher, but the ice will be grainy, and you can literally see the grains on a straw or even on the side of the pitcher. Since I am strictly interested in using ice for my velvet smooth daily chocolate mint protein almond milk smoothie, I have to send it back.

I bought some metal straws so I can reuse those as well. My smoothies come out so smooth and creamy! Took me a little while to get the proportions of frozen fruit to liquid figured out, but it's super easy now. A+

Author: Woodpecker
Title: I drink a smoothie every day now
Body: So glad I got this, best blender I’ve ever used by far. Individual cups are great—I haven’t used the large chamber yet, the cups are too convenient. I make a fruit smoothie every morning now before my bike ride to work, it’s super quick and easy—entire cup blends in about 5 seconds. There is some twisting in the plastic which keeps powders, seeds, and fruit from getting stuck in the corners—genius. The super sharp blade is easy to (carefully) clean off in the sink right after use. Cups, tops, and blade are all fine in my high-heat dishwasher. I usually use silicone straws, but I have a large (smoothie style) steel straw which DOES fit into the cup-top opening! Super convenient if my partner needs to take it in the car to work. Not completely spill-proof but about 90%. The suction cups on the bottom of the blender base are a great addition, keeps it from sliding around on the counter. Definitely recommend this ninja for every-day use!

The only caution is the blender blades are very sharp. I mean don't touch them or you will get cut. You have to be very careful handling the blades.I also like that the blender blades are at several levels. I don't get any of that air sucking in and preventing the drink from blending properly. Really makes a smooth drink.

Author: altsmitty
Title: 2 problems in 2 months
Body: I actually really like the blending power of this ninja, but I've had two issues already. First, one of the little suction feet came off. It doesn't seem like that would be a big deal, but we had to order a special small star screwdriver to take the bottom part off and reattach it, and even with the right tool, it wasn't easy.Then, button 3 for high blending stopped working altogether. I bought it two months ago so I couldn't return it to Amazon so I contacted ninja. They are sending a new base, but they were going to charge me $21 to ship the base. I balked at this so they are waiving the fee 'this' time. Anyway, I wouldn't buy it again.

Author: darlene
Title: smells like it is overheating within 30 seconds
Body: I hate this thing! The individual cups are not big enough, and the lids do not have a plug so I can't take it with me anywhere. The big pitcher is too big for medium sized smoothies. It takes at least two minutes to get them smooth enough that I don't have to chew ingredients, but the motor is designed for a one minute maximum usage, or it will overheat. I've tried making a full size smoothie in it, but It smells like it is overheating after about 30 seconds, so I have to make it in short episodes. It was a gift so can't return it.I had a different version Ninja with the AutoIQ Blend feature and it was great until it died.

Author: John Smith
Title: Repairability is a joke, and it's not as dishwasher-safe as claimed
Body: I bought this in December 2019 for about $80.My dishwasher melted part of the plastic on the pitcher, and now the lid won't close. Make sure you have your dishwasher on the lowest temperature settings, just in case!I'm most disappointed, though, that replacement parts are ridiculous to source - I need one small part of the pitcher (the little bit that covers the moving part that pushes the button in the base as part of the safety mechanism to keep you from activating it without the pitcher on and the lid shut), but my options apparently are:- Pay $64 (that's $16 less than the price I paid for the whole thing) to buy an entire new pitcher directly from the company (which is out of stock, so I'll have to wait an unknown amount of time, and that's if they decide to ever make more, which they probably won't because they seem to have a new model for sale)- Pay MORE THAN I PAID FOR THE WHOLE THING to get an entire new pitcher on Amazon. The only reason it's cheaper than replacing the entire thing is because Amazon has raised the price by 50% since I bought it.Replacement parts should be available and affordable. And when I say parts, I mean every single component, not just complete accessories.

Author: smiley
Title: Best ever!
Body: I love this Ninja blender. It's powerful and easy to use. I like having the different size containers. The big one makes blending smoothie bowls easy. It's a great price and lasts well. This is my second one since they originally came out. It's the best!

Title: We are in our second Ninja now.
Body: We love how well the Ninja works because of the blades on the central post. It's easy to clean, but do not put the lid in the dishwasher - wash it by hand. The lid is the weak link, and you can't just buy another lid! Had our first one 10 years, but didn't read instructions about lid, which is why we have a second Ninja now.

The blades are super sharp, I did cut myself on it when I cleaned it early on but I'm much more careful now. I love that the blade pulls right out for easy cleaning. It is a bit noisy but works too good for me to care about that. Definitely would recommend!

The media could not be loaded.

Title: So fast!! Love it!!
Body: I love that it is very powerful and easy to use, incredibly fast. Has safety features to help lock in place so no kitchen disaster happens. Only drawback is it is loud, but I've never heard of a quiet blender! The blades are sharp and do not lock in place like a regular blender so take blade out first before you pour.

Title: This is our second Ninja in two years and we now have two broken blenders
Body: I have forgotten what happened with the first one, but our second one which was purchased six months ago the pitcher handle is already broken and in order for the mechanics to work the lid has to attach to the handle just right. We do use the blender frequently and put pitcher in the dishwasher, so maybe it is not safe for dishwasher as they say it is in the description. I don't know, but that is the only way you can fully clean a pitcher, especially if you are using peanut butter or honey or frozen fruits. The mechanics (motor) works great, but when you don't have a pitcher that will attach correctly to it......you can't make a smoothie :(

Body: I use this blender every day to make smoothies with frozen fruit. It takes all but 8 seconds. Just a wonderful product. I had my first one for 12 years before it got tired. Then I replaced it with the new model which wasn't as user friendly. So, this is the original and it gets my highest recommendation!

Author: Agnes Schoenberger

Body: This was my best purchase so fat this year! 💕

Author: M. King & A. Petersen
Title: Good Buy
Body: I have used the blender has been used several times, so far it works well and has had no issues. It is easy to clean and I like the multiple containers to accommodate various sizes. It is larger and takes up a bit of counter space, but it is worth it. I have used it to make smoothies, milkshakes, and cheese sauce so far and everything has worked smoothly. It has not leaked or made a mess. This is definitely a better investment than buying a lower quality blender. I highly recommend it.

Body: The power this thing has is amazing. It blends frozen fruit and ice like they're water. I use the to go cups more than the main blender for easy use and it's so easy to make my shakes in the morning. The only flaw mine has, is the top of the to-go cups leak if I tilt it too much. Definitely a good buy in my opinion though.

Body: The cups with this ninja blender are barely big enough to hold a full smoothie so most the time you’re overflowing making a mess everywhere. Didn’t realize how small these cups are and the bigger cups don’t fit this blender. Sucks.

Author: Betsy Soukup

Body: The to-go cups for this blender frequently get stuck inside the base, requiring a significant amount of twisting force to remove. This renders about half the product useless.

Author: dalton
Title: Do not buy this blender
Body: I do not like this blender. The single serve cup is way to small and a pain to clean. The large pitcher is to big and also very difficult to clean. The blending power is pretty good but not as good as others. The design is mediocre and I am not impressed with this blender.

Author: Amazon User
Title: Superb blender
Body: The blender power is truly fantastic. Super quick and effective. Very reasonable noise level. Produces a thick perfectly blended smoothie. Can’t beat this for the price.

Author: Mary
Title: Very light weight not meant for heavy use
Body: This is an inexpensive alternative to the heavy hitters but you will be replacing it quickly if using regularly.

Author: Dennis Hughes
Title: Very useful appliance
Body: Functions as advertised

Author: LizP
Title: After 2.5 years of minimal use no power
Body: Purchased December 2019 and went to use after sitting on the shelf for months and I can not get any power to it. I’ve tried both the large pitcher and single serve container and nothing lights up. Outlet is fine, went through the Amazon troubleshooting video and nothing worked. I’ve used it at most 15 times and everything else is in excellent condition. Blades are extremely sharp as I’ve cut my finger washing them in the past. Thought I’d splurge and get a “good” blender but learned my lesson and will never buy ninja again. Up until this point it lived up to the hype, but for the little bit of use I’ve given it, there’s no reason it shouldn’t work after 2.5 years.

Author: JH
Title: So great
Body: This thing is awesome

Author: Cindy KQ
Title: Love it
Body: This is my second Ninja blender, used only to grind up kitchen compost. It was on sale for $99, some 200 to 300 cheaper than an official compost grinder I saw advertised. It works so very well--my compost is ready to use in some 6 weeks versus many months when composted traditionally. Icing on the cake, I got the little smoothie blenders, too. VERY happy.

Author: Epac
Title: Piece of junk
Body: It broke only after a few use. Junk

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not as powerful as described

Dry shape!!!! ( see pic ), so A couple of time I was careless I almost cut my hands and fingers, ( if they manfactsaw this; I hope they would make some kind of cover / protected for the brands!!! Especially think of doing it for the children!!! ) the other issue is the noise; because of it's power; it's really loud, I need very loud, another wish; they would make a cover; clover the blender ( my vitamix quiet one did Judy as that; it's very powerful but quiet ), so it won't be as loud, anyway; br cause of it's price and the quality I really think this blender deserves a 4 star. Again; it suppose to be a 5/6 star but the blade and noise issue....... would I buy it again; most definitely ( but I think i might alternate the blade or make a / or some special cover for it, just so it's more save for everyone, just it case, safety comes 1st!!! ).

Author: S winter

Body: I was really excited for this. The large blender is great and works well.Unfortunately the smaller blender, you have to hold the button to pulsate and it struggles with the ice and frozen fruit. Very disappointed for my on the go smoothies. :( Previously I was using a nutribullet and it was more efficient and convenient.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Smoothies or Margaritas?
Body: Bought this one for my Mom after her blender died. I have the same blender and it works great. I have to watch out for the blades as they are very shape and I have cut myself on them taking them in and out of the dishwasher. This blender works great for smoothies with the small cups or to make margaritas with the larger pitcher. Easy to use, easy to clean and my other Ninja blender is going strong after 10 years of hard work. I would definitely recommend this product.

Title: Best blender I’ve ever had!

Author: Nicole
Title: I expected better
Body: My husband bought this for me as a birthday present February 2020. It has been sitting in my cabinet up until the last week & a half. Never touched it until then. I’m gonna say I’ve been using it 10 days & it’s already falling apart. There’s cracks in it. The handle holds condensation making it a breading ground for mold which is concerning & somehow food is getting stuck in the little crevices at the bottom. I did try to unscrew the handle to clean it better but that was unsuccessful I’m pretty sure I’d break it if I tried harder. The smoothie cups it comes with are too small & it’s not universal at all so I can’t just buy bigger cups, to my knowledge, I tried to buy some & they didn’t fit the single serve blade. The bottom piece on the pitcher looks like it’s also coming unglued I guess you would say. Also don’t come for me for my sink, I’m doing the dishes now 🤣Idk I’m just overall disappointed because I know the cost is high but the product is cheap. I will say it’s easy to use though I guess.

I cannot complain about anything pertaining to the blender itself, safety, mixing, processing, pulverizing, all great. Just a bit to big in my eyes. Great price for what it can be utilezed for. Title: Buy it!
Body: If you need a new blender, THIS IS IT!! I love Ninja products and this blender is excellent quality for a great price. The actual blender is plastic which is awesome because it's not heavy to handle empty or full. The blender 'locks' into place so you know it's secure before blending. Little rubber knobs on the bottom of base keep the blender from moving. The pouring spout on top is a bonus. The blades are multi layer and sharp. Buttons are user friendly. Included was a recipe book to get you started with ideas. We made an excellent pina colada and can't wait to make more. Dishwasher cleaned it up effectively. Overall, this blender is awesome and well made! Very very happy with my purchase! Buy it!!!!

If you look more closely, you’ll see many many negative reviews that I wish I had paid more attention to :(( it’s a shame it stopped working right after my return period expired.

Author: MonTex
Title: Best blender we're owned, period.
Body: For the price, efficiency, ease of use, and power, this affordable blender has been awesome. Durability is yet to be determined and since it is mostly plastic, our Oster with its glass and solid stainless steel base will outlast this Ninja by decades in my estimation. Other than that, it's a joy to use.

Title: Powerful, fast, easy to clean. Has to go" containers."
Body: No problems, great item! Powerful, fast, easy to clean. Has 2 to go containers. Works great for crushed ice drinks, cocktails, shakes, smoothies, sauces, anything you need blended.

Author: T Arthur
Title: cheaply built food processor - not good for smoothies - why are these so popular?
Body: I replaced a 2 year old kitchenmaid blender with this one - I use a blender for one purpose - to make a smoothie most weekday mornings. After 6 months I'm giving up and junking it. But really, this unit was never suitable for what I bought it for - so getting rid of it is overdue.The positives: It's relatively quiet, and the unique blade design draws food into the large pitcher without tamping.The negatives:- The blade design creates a vortex that really makes this more of a food processor than a blender. If you want to make a puree for soup, it's great. If you like your smoothies very grainy and chewy, then it's fine. To get one even remotely smooth I had to blend for about 3 minutes, and even then nuts, for example, are still very grainy- cleanup - also due to the blade design, there's no self-clean feature, so you have to put the pitcher and parts in the dishwasher. However, despite manufacturer claims, it's not dishwasher safe and starts to leak all over the base and the counter after two weeks. This happened with two different pitchers, so it's not a fluke. If you choose to buy one anyway, they will try to sell you the replacement pitcher for $80, but if you refuse to pay they will eventually give it to you - but it will still fail in two weeks. I kept using mine and cleaning up after it, and after 3 months the pitcher just cracked.- The cup (with more traditional blade) actually works reasonably well for making a smoothie - however, I found 16 ounces to be too small to be useful. (Note that they have apparently corrected this in the newer model by increasing the smoothie cup to 24 ounces, so if you must have a ninja, then definitely go with the newer model). You can't get a larger replacement cup for this base - I tried.- Aside from making grainy smoothies and falling apart quickly, as others have noted the blade is hazardous if you aren't careful, so please be careful if you do buy one.

Author: William Monacci
Title: Don’t buy this blender
Body: The blender jar cracked in multiple places after 6 months of morning use. Liquids migrated into parts of the blender jar that can be cleaned. Customer support poor. Would not buy again.

Author: C.A. Harrell
Title: Lid locking mechanism broke. Replacement not available. Cannot recommend.
Body: Amazon receipt indicates purchase date of April 21, 2021. Have used perhaps a dozen times. Today, April 7, 2022, brought blender out to make breakfast smoothies. Lid release did not function, necessitating prying the lid off. Seems that piece of the plunger mechanism had broken off and was rattling about the inside of the lid housing. Searched for a replacement lid, but it is only available with a replacement carafe - $65 plus tax and shipping - more than 50 percent of the purchase price. Should have followed my instincts and bought a Vita-Mix.

Body: Love the two single size cups, use them for fruit smoothies a couple times a day. Easy to clean, just be careful, the blades are sharp. It is pretty loud when pushing the pulse button (for making smoothies) and it tends to wander across the counter if I don't hold onto it while it's running. I do love how the blender units all lock in place on the power base, made so the connection is fully and properly engaged before you can turn it on, which means there's no risk of it getting bumped off or jiggled during operation.

Title: Love the individual blending cups
Body: We chose this model because it included the individual blending cups, but I was concerned because some reviewers said the cups were too small. The 16oz cups are the perfect size for our smoothies and they make clean-up incredibly easy. I initially thought I’d use a cup if I was just making a smoothie for one person and I’d use the larger pitcher for two or more people, but now I realize making even two or more smoothies in the cups is better - I can make each smoothie to each child’s particular preference, the blade in the cup is incredibly effective, and I prefer the ease of rinsing off the cup blade to cleaning out the whole pitcher and the larger s-blades.Another surprise benefit is the blending power. I use chia seeds in our smoothies and I love that the little cup blade is able to pulverize them - no more weird chia seed texture and no more whole chia seeds stuck in our teeth.As much as I love the 16oz cups, I’m glad we have the larger pitcher too. I do a lot of baking and like to use the pitcher for blending ingredients. The ingredients for a double-batch of 24 muffins fit in the pitcher no problem and blended perfectly.It is very loud and you wouldn’t want to run it while someone is sleeping, but that isn’t an issue for us.

Author: Monica Salley
Title: I was better off with the smaller nutribullet
Body: I own a nutribullet, but it is too small to do all the things that I need for a family of 5, so I decided to get a bigger blender. The first time I used it, I blended ice to make snow cones and it worked perfectly (the video showed this very product blending ice so I figured since it worked this time, it would be great. Well, this thing does not completely blend up anything that I put through it (cooked veggies, sugar, cinnamon sticks). I've had to resort back to using my small nutribullet because the blade works way better. I've followed all directions on this product and paid a lot of money for this thing to not work properly. Find another product.

Author: Shervin
Title: Ring Develops Toxic Mold | No Replacement Available
Body: These problems have developed after a short period of occasional use and immediate washing and drying after each use.(1) The flawed design of the blade unit features a cavity that houses a ring to provide a seal. You wouldn't know it exists unless you look for it. The manual doesn't mention the need for it to be taken out for cleaning either. In no time, it develops toxic mold that deeply penetrates the material, impossible to clean or remove with any method. They offer no replacement for this ring and you are forced to buy the entire base unit of the blade that costs a 1/3 of the unit no including the shipping. Third party rings do not fit this item. So essentially it is a disposable garbage.(2) The base unit itself, shown here develops many visible marks and dents after a short period of use. It means that probably lots of microplastics end up in the blend. All of Ninja's other models have this problem as well, which is why I moved to Braun.(3) Also the dark coloration of the base means that if mold is growing on the plastic, it will simply not be visible to the naked eye.In spite of the aggressive marketing of Ninja as a top notch brand, it's performance, design and longevity record leaves much to be desired.

Author: JenS
Title: cubed ice to snow in a few seconds!
Body: I just wanted something to make Frappuccinos since I'm going broke at Starbucks! Wow! This blender delivers! It terminates ice cubes in seconds. I have not perfected a recipe for a Frapp yet but it's coming. A great plus is that I'm making lemon sours for me and Sno Balls for the grandkids! I love it. It is loud - especially crushing ice, but I have never seen an ice crusher that wasn't loud, so not an issue for me.

Author: doug
Title: Did not work for my smoothie use!
Body: I’m giving it two stars because it did at least work. When I did my homework on the two most important things a blender should have according to the professional experts is a square bottom and fix blades in the bottom that don’t come out just like every professional blender out there. So I was already skeptical at the very large center post with cutters in this mixer but yet everyone had high reviews of it. My first problem came when it didn’t have enough power or the cutting blades in the right place to cut up the solids in my smoothie like almonds and flaxseeds. The second problem is the giant post with the cutters in the center took up far too much room inside the picture making it a much smaller size picture than normal. The third problem came with every time you clean it out if you forget to grab that post with the cutters it falls out landing in the sink and potentially breaking the cutters or worse yet cutting you picking it back up to deal with it . So in my opinion for my needs this Mixer was far under powered and incorrectly designed for the use of making smoothies where is solids are involved like nuts and seeds. I ended up returning it and buying one with the square bottom and fixed cutters in the bottom like they all should be

Author: V. Silva
Title: Stay away from this blender
Body: This blender has many critical flaws that you should consider before buying.First, the threads in the cups are proprietary. Better blenders will allow you to use just about any mason jar for blending which is really convenient to reduce clean up time and waste.Second, the blades are a death trap. This blender has so many annoying safety features like it will only power on when locked in one position with the lid on (which makes it terrible for some soups since you can’t push the contents down), but at the same time every person that tries to clean the blades ends up cutting themselves. Seriously flawed and unsafe design.Third, the lip on the lid required two hand operation, it will not stay open when pouring without tilting it back.Lastly, the cup is way too narrow. In an effort to make this blender incompatible with standard mason jars they made the smoothie cups way too narrow, making them impossible to clean with just a sponge.Basically this is an average blender, with proprietary features that make it worse than a standard blender. Pass on this product and either go for a higher end model or a cheaper blender that uses standard components.

I would not have bought it if it had mentioned that on-line. EVERYTHING has to be pulsed. You cannot set it to stay on unless you hold your finger on the button. Supposedly it has 3 speeds. I can't see any differences. It has a pulse button, but what good is it? You must turn the machine off. Every other Ninja turns off after about 5 minutes. This has less features than a $50 ordinary blender. It had the outrageous price of $120. DO NOT BUY!!!

Body: Before placing the order w/Amazon, I 'google' searched for the 'best' blenders. This Ninja BL660 model was highly rated, so I ordered it because my last blender (purchased from Costco), which was maybe 3 years broke a week prior. You're supposed to push the button on the top and that releases it from the base. Well that stopped working, which is why I had to get a new one. My new blender was delivered the next day (love that Amazon feature). When I pulled it out the box, I realized it was the exact blender that just broke on me. Had I paid better attention, I would not have purchased the exact same blender because I anticipate having the same issue in 3 more years. The blender was only $100, so I guess spending $33.33 per year to blend smoothies isn't too bad. I also don't care for the plastic container - would definitely prefer glass. Next time....

Author: Tracie_Renee
Title: Best Blender I've had yet...
Body: My last blender was a Kitchen Aide 5-Speed 600 watt Diamond Blender. It lasted a fair amount of years before it recently started having motor issues. I was disappointed in it which is why I went a second round with Ninja. My first Ninja was a motor-on-top blender and it was okay, but that particular model wasn't a fit for me. Enter the Ninja BL660 Professional Countertop Blender with 1100-Watt Base, and 72 oz pitcher. There is nothing I don't like about this blender. It's quiet. My KA was so loud that you couldn't have a conversation even on the lowest speed. And speaking of speed...the 1100 watts means that my frozen fruit morning smoothies are being blended on low speed in less time and with more consistency than any blender I've ever used. I make 48 ounces of smoothie five days a week, 48 weeks a year. I've only had this blender for just over two weeks, so I'm not going to be able to speak to longevity at this point, but I will update my review when I can. My KA was what I call blade on the bottom technology. Due to that and it's lower wattage, my old KA used to have a massive air bubble in the smoothy that made it difficult and time consuming to deal with on a constant basis. The Ninja spindle blade is better technology, in my opinion. Having blades up and down on a spindle means that the blending is happening in the entire pitcher and not just on the bottom. This results in way better consistency every time. And less time spent blending, which should translate to longevity if I'm not abusing it to make it do what I need it to do. The base is lite. My KA weight in a whopping 12 pounds and I dropped it once because it was heavy for a one-handed pick up. I love the fact that it has suction cups on the bottom of the base. Although I did have to put a towel under it for storage so those suction cups didn't stick to where I had it stored...the stability of having it stuck onto the counter is priceless. And that lid! Fully locking, including the pour spout. My KA had a rubber lid and over time it stopped being tight to stay on without me holding it. My blender pitcher, lid and blade will only ever be hand-washed. I know what the manufacturer says, but dishwashers do to dishes what dryers do to clothes. To potentially increase the longevity of this blender I'm not using the dishwasher. I was super excited to get the the two individual 16 ounce cups. While these will not be used for smoothies because a single smoothie is 24 ounces a piece....these will be perfect for mixed drinks, or a simple crushed fruit smoothy snack. I'm so pleased with this purchase and I'm hoping this lasts a while.

If you do, make sure your hand is not near it. Please learn from my naivety and my visit to the ER and the resulting six stitches. She real sharp, I promise.
