Author: MrSalsa
Title: You can't add ingredients while the blender is running!
Body: I just bought the Ninja Professional Blender BL621.This is an excellent, powerful blender, and I would recommend it for anyone who blends drinks that do not require you to add ingredients while the blender is running. Unlike most other blenders, there is no opening in the lid to facilitate that. This is the only negative, and it is why this blender will not work for me. I make protein drinks and I like to add protein powder and liquid lecithin while the blender is on, so it doesn't cake and stick to the blender walls, and so the oil disperses evenly (which will not happen if you add oil before you start the blender). With the Ninja, I had to put everything in before starting the blender, and the powder clumped and stuck to the blender walls. I tried a second time, attempting to pour the powder in the little pour spout, which pops open. That spout is too small and some of the powder ended up on the counter, plus with that spout open, the mixture splattered out and up and got all over the cabinets above the blender. Thus, you can't even attempt to add ingredients through the pour spout because of major splattering; keep that spout closed while running. So, if you don't need to add ingredients while the blender is running, Ninja is a 5 star blender; if you do, you absolutely cannot use this blender. Also, the removable blade column has razor sharp blades; be very careful when handling!

Body: The machines really isn't much louder than any other blender that actually has power. The blades are VERY sharp and cut the skin easily, I found this out cleaning it the first time, the manual suggests using a bristle brush to clean the blade. Blade also comes out of the pitcher which makes for easier cleaning. Lid locks and machines wont start until everything is lined up and secure. Personal smoothie option works great, but does not have a level or time button- just a pulse option that you have to hold down. Even made hummus and it turned out very smooth and creamy with good blending of flavors.

Body: The only blenders I've ever owned were less than $20 and all plastic. I read the manual upon receiving my new Ninja and the warnings about the sharp blades were clear. I took them to heed but managed to slice myself twice on the initial cleaning. The blades are virtually razors so please be warned.I've made salsa and vegetable drinks and this thing seems to make quick work out of carrots, celery, kale and whatever else I've tossed in there.For the price, I'm happy and expect to have it for many years. As long as I keep all of my fingers, that is!

Title: not as good as the Ninja Ultima Blender
Body: Had the Ninja Ultima blender for five years, which was used almost daily for smoothies until it stopped working. This new Ninja just doesn't blend everything quite as well: apples get blended down to tiny pieces, but not completely, same with peanut butter. There are still tiny chunks so you're not getting a well blended smoothie. Not sure why this is happening as the power is the same. This new one is lighter generally (the blades and the base/motor) and is definitely quieter than the Ultima, but as an overall experience, the Ultima was superior for sure. This one feels a little cheaper/flimsier and I don't expect to still be using it in five year's time.

My threenager thinks it's the loudest thing ever and will run into the kitchen to tell me every time I use it so if that matters to you maybe look for a quieter blender.. if that even exists?! Title: Great for Smoothie Diet

All our fruits are frozen so it has been put to the test every day. I rarely use the extra cups, unless I need to grind flax seed, but they have been nice.The machine seems to stir up the freak out in our cat, as we turn it on and she begins to race around the house. But it isn't that noisy. As far as cleaning goes I hate to clean this. It isn't terrible, but the blade is sharp so you have to be careful on top of trying to get in between the blades really clean. If we didn't make smoothies every day I would be happy to throw it in the dishwasher but we don't run that every day.

Author: Keith Paris
Title: Not the same high quality as my previous Ninja Pro - updated Dec21
Body: This is the BL660 model - Base unit quit working after a dozen uses - Ninja is sending a replacement but I have to pay for shipping and taxes. I purchased this to replace my older model that started leaking and was difficult to fix. I thought I would buy a new unit for just $15 more that purchasing a replacement pitcher and parts. I like certain features such as the quietness of the new unit, but I now have to use the spindle in the new one where the older one had a blade fixed in the pitcher. The plastic on the new unit is not the same quality, and the dishwasher safe parts are top-rack safe only unlike the older model. I also use to process hot vegetables that I cooked first prior to blending, but the new unit is rated for that.One last comment which is about the delivery, USPS delivered to my door, left the box on the front stoop in the rain and the box was soaked by the time I discovered it at 10am. UPS always bagged items that were left in the rain, USPS does not bag them, knock on the door during delivery, or any such courtesy. The USPS web site even showed it as not out for delivery when I check gthe site at 7am, but supposedly it went on the truck at 7:10am and was delivered at 7:38am in the rain. I was home the entire time, and never heard the truck arrive. Just a gripe about USPS.

Author: PJ
Title: I’m so in love
Body: I’m so in love with this! I had the old school Ninja (the one where you put the motor on the top) for well over 10 years, so I knew that I wanted another Ninja when it was time to purchase a new one. I knew I wanted a blender that had the different levels of blades, because I hate when the stuff at the top doesn’t get blended and you have to keep stopping and stirring. So that is why I chose this one. What I wasn’t expecting was how cool these smoothie cups are! My smoothies are so creamy and well blended. Clean up is easy and I love that I can drink out of the same cup it’s blended in!Tip: fill your smoothie cup at night and freeze,.......example,.....put in the spinach, strawberries, bananas, grapes ,...at night and freeze it. Then in the morning, just pour in some coconut water or orange juice and blend it. No ice needed. The flavor is so intense when you don’t add ice.

Author: Maria Dambrosio
Title: sending it back
Body: I had a couple major hangups with this blender. On the pro side, it had a plenty powerful motor and the 72 oz pitcher could hold anything I had any interest in blending. However, where the 16oz cups were fine for my standard protein shakes that are based with 8oz water, they were useless for my husband's fresh fruit based smoothies. If you think you're going to use anything more than half a banana, 2 strawberries and half a dozen blueberries with all the usual smoothie things (yogurt, ice, water/milk/protein powder) think again. It didn't even come close to fitting in the 16oz cups. So I see Ninja makes 24oz and 32oz cups. Except they are not compatible with this blender...you have to have the AutoIQ variety blenders for those puppies. So return initiated.My last gripe is literally, the box. Not to be fussy, but if you are going to create packaging that is exact fit, you need to label the compartments how they fit together. I applaud the effort to minimalize packaging, but prepping it for the return felt like I was putting together a 1000 piece jigsaw puzzle. Make it easy for us, please. Or, buyer beware, as you take things out of the package, take an extra moment as you unpack and do what Ninja didn't do for us...label the box slots.And do note, the stack blade of the pitcher is a pain in the neck to clean. I won't call it a total con but blech...If you want a blender that can whip up a pitcher of margaritas, this is great. But if you are a daily smoothie/shake like us, the 16oz cups are too small and the 72oz pitcher is too big. It wasn't the worst appliance I ever bought but was disappointed that it was that dysfunctional for our daily needs.

Author: Wyomi
Title: Doesn't work well for what I want
Body: I was excited to receive this and start making my daily smoothies, however I am not happy with it. I thought the multilevel blades feature would make the blending process better, however it does not have the power to vertically move the contents and get a good mix.The tower of blades is easily removable, which is good and bad. If you want to make multiple batches you do need to be careful to not have the blades fall out. With the blades removed, it is a slightly easier to squeegee the contents out, however it is very difficult to get the product off of the very sharp blades so you are still wasting product.The lid has a tight locking seal which means no ability to vent it or to add things during the blending process like a traditional blender. It is also a pain to remove the lid when adding to the blender.It is quieter than my last two blenders - one was a ninja.I believe that I will return this as I am very unhappy with the product. I bet it works well for some people, it is just not a good choice for me.

Author: NortheastGal
Title: Terrible customer service from Ninja on an appliance that's NOT made to last
Body: I really, really liked this blender - at first. It seemed quite powerful and blended well, although it was very loud. I even considered wearing ear muffs when using it.But after 6 months of owning it, using it a few times per week mostly to make shakes, the lid refused to come off of the blender jar.Previously, I would depress the RELEASE button, which would move the locking tabs into the unit and allow you to lift the handle up and lift the top off. Now, no matter how hard I pressed, the handle wouldn't release at all.It seems that this is a known problem with these blenders, since I found videos on YouTube explaining how to remove the cover.Once I got the cover off, I took it apart expecting to find food debris clogging up the mechanisms inside. However, there was NO food debris inside at all.I called Ninja, since the blender was still under the 1-year warranty. The woman I spoke with offered me a new jar with a cover for half of the usual $64 price. I mentioned that my blender was still under warranty, but she said the warranty covered the motor, and not normal wear and tear. Huh???? How is a defective lid normal wear and tear?I just wanted a new lid, but she wouldn't budge. I spent $100 on this blender 6 months ago, and now it won't work.So, I have a $100 paperweight now. NOT recommended.

Body: If you’re not using ice, or if you’re using the single serve cups, this machine is amazing. I want to love this blender but I’ve had it for a little under two years and the pitcher has cracked. It’s so disappointing because the power of the blender is great and it makes great smoothies, however, to track down a replacement pitcher is difficult. You can find them....but they’re $60-70, which is almost as much a a new blender. I’m disappointed in that aspect as now I’m reading reviews for a new blender.

Author: J. Churchill
Title: Fragile plastic pitcher
Body: This worked great for four months. After about 50 uses, the plastic pitcher became cloudy from tiny scratches on the inside from food blending around. Recently, the pitcher developed a noticeable crack near the spout, which has now broken a piece off. It's still working, but probably not for much longer. Looking up replacement parts, the pitcher is only $15 less than what we paid for the whole blender kit. This blender is just not worth it if they aren't going to provide a strong glass pitcher.

Author: Grace Lytle
Title: Broke after 6 months
Body: After a few months of use the blender started smoking and stopped working

Author: Cody price
Title: Enjoy more than vitamix 5200
Body: I had made a smooth everyday for several years with my roommates vitamix 5200. I decided a few weeks ago that I should get my own blender and decided to try this one instead. While the vitamix 5200 does blend more thoroughly, I would often have to stop and start the vitamix several times with me needing to stand by the blend to make sure the top didn't pop off. I never have to do that with the ninja. It doesn't get hair pockets and I can walk away while it blends. It also holds more volume, the pouring is so much easier the way the lid is designed, and the cleaning process is much easier with the square container that doesn't have all the creases that the vitamix does. Absolutely love this blender!

Author: ivan de jesus fuentes
Title: Powerful
Body: Easy to use

Author: Housmith
Title: ALMOST DIED BECAUSE OF THIS BLENDER!!!!!!
Body: I have had this blender for just over a year and only use it once every other week so not too often. Today it exploded!!! The blade flew out and cut a hole through the pitcher and almost hit my 8 month old puppy and I !!!!! See my photos!!!! The force was so strong that it bent the spoon that was beside it almost in half and it flew across the kitchen. PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS as it is extremely unsafe and I would never want anyone to experience what I did today. My puppy is still scared and also almost ate the debris from the pitcher ... PLEASE I AM WARNING you do NOT buy this!!!!!! I will make sure to post this anywhere I can - I don’t want others to get hurt!!!!!!!!

Author: Jessie petro
Title: Buyer be ware
Body: Used it for less than 2 years. Blending is not as good as I expected Suddenly the lid won't operate properly. Replacement lid is $51.00. That's ridiculous - just tries to force you to purchase a new blender. Won't be repeating this mistake.

Author: Thomas C Shaw
Title: Ninja Rocks
Body: Love this.

Author: Pen
Title: Love it!
Body: I was looking for something with more power than what I had been using, so I got this based on my sister’s recommendation. I am not disappointed. Yes, it’s noisy, but it doesn’t bother me. I use the 16 ounce cups since it’s just me. I am able to add a couple more ingredients than my other single serve blender could handle, so that is great! Cleans up pretty good, but you do have to make sure the blades get clean. I noticed my ground flaxseed likes to cling to the blades, so I have to be mindful when cleaning. Speaking of which-it’s been my experience with this model that if you use any powders in your smoothies (ground flaxseed, collagen, matcha, etc), you should put those in last if you’re using the 16 ounce cup to blend in, otherwise, they will stick to the bottom and not get blended. Overall, I’m 100% satisfied!EDIT***I'll feign ignorance on this issue-depending on how often you use the blender or the cups, you need to take the gasket out either after each use or at least once or twice a week. I did not and wow, what a smell! The original gasket still works, but an odor (from my fruit smoothies) has permeated it. It's not pleasant, and there were times when I thought I had cleaned good around the blade and the cup then put the blade back on the cup only to come in the next day and have an very overpowering...stench. I've ordered replacement gaskets which are working totally fine, and they aren't from Ninja. But to keep your original gaskets (and blade area and cup/pitcher) from stinking up, clean them often/very often as I recommended above.

Author: Jackie Driscoll
Title: Two issues in the first two months
Body: Blends pretty well, but I've only had it two months and have already had two issues. After about a month, the single serve function started malfunctioning. It would sometimes blend and then stop, with the lights blinking. Other times the lights would be blinking and it wouldn't blend. This was all without the cup being too full and with it locked in place properly. I contacted Ninja and they sent a replacement quickly, so I was really happy with their service.Then I looked at the pitcher, which I hadn't used or even taken out of the box yet. One of the bottom corners was smashed and it will not be usable. Since I didn't notice until after the return window had closed, I'm stuck with a broken pitcher which costs almost as much as the whole blender to replace!

Author: Shannon Canterbury
Title: Easy to make cheap shake at home
Body: So easy to put a few berry's in and some low cal juice for a great drink

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Buy it
Body: Great blender with multiple options, easy to use

Author: Esther C.
Title: Perfect for making smoothies
Body: I would order again. It would also make a perfect Christmas gift for college students.

Author: Elvira Osmanova
Title: The best
Body: Great blender

Author: Sergio

Body: We using it every day and we love it!!!

Author: RahTawn

Body: We love our new blender... No more Jamba Juice expenses. It's great for all chipping and blending needs.

Author: Deanna Shaw
Title: Awesome Blender
Body: Absolutely love this blender.....Great for small single smoothies, coffee, or blending large veggies, fruit, muffin mixes.....

Author: Holly M Brown
Title: Easy to use & clean!
Body: Great for making morning smoothies! Bought one for my son & he loves it too!

Author: brach999
Title: Powerful and efficient for frozen smoothies.
Body: Blenders are going to make noise but it is really fast to blend so that is a winner in my book.

Author: M
Title: Mostly perfect
Body: It's a great blender. The one thing I don't like is that you can't close the smoothie cups. There is always an open mouth in the lid. Smoothies settle overnight. It would be nice to shake it up in the cup.

Author: pope
Title: works good a bit loud.
Body: the smoothie cup needs to be bigger. but i like the unit.

Author: J. Baudoin
Title: Blender jar cracked, hard to clean, but strong motor
Body: I've had this blender for less than two years and the blender jar developed more stress cracks over time until one started leaking. Now, we use it daily and the power is awesome. My kids still use the cups for smoothies.Now, cleaning the blender jar was a nightmare. There are so many crevices for mildew to form! I washed it everyday, but some areas were nearly impossible to keep clean without having to resort to bleach soaks. I never had that trouble with my Kitchenaid.Finally, when I first read the reviews for this blender, someone commented how she never had to use a stir stick because nothing ever stick along the sides. She must have just blended soft things and ice. I blend spinach and protein powder with my smoothies and I almost always had to scrape down the corners . It's a square!Otherwise, the motor was and is a champ.

Author: PrettyLynn
Title: It blends quick
Body: I love my new blender it blends quick &easy to use

Author: Mary OMalley
Title: Very powerful
Body: I bought this because my old blender died in the middle of a project and the reason why I got this is that it was the only one that would be delivered in a day. And I am so glad. It is so much more powerful than my old one. I think it is because the blades aren't just at the bottom. This one is even less expensive than my old one! So I am happy that my old blender broke!

Author: Mallinda williams

Body: I was berry disappointed with the product it look very cheap the mug was plastic I taught it was glass and the side cup was not PBA balance. I give it away I did not like it not impressed.?

Body: Absolutely love this blender. Easy to clean and blends very well. I’d recommend this blender over any other blender in the market. Works wonderful for frozen fruit. Blends up food very fine to fees m y baby nephew when he is over visiting. Priced really well and shipped to us really fast.

Title: DON’T BUY, Can’t blend avocado anymore
Body: Not a good product! Only used it for a couple months and kale is coming out as is. The picture is showing chunks of avocado after blending for 2 minutes! Can’t even blend avocado for 2 minutes!!! Are you kidding me??? Save your money. Only works fine long enough for the return window to close.

Title: This thing SUCKS!
Body: This is a TERRIBLE product! I bought 2...they both cracked and leaked. Worst yet...I can’t return the 2nd one because it’s JUST been over 2 days! It cracked right away then in 3 weeks started leaking!

Author: Das junk
Title: Great deal for under $100
Body: I don't see how a $300 blender could be better than this one. I suppose there are different speeds with some others, but blenders all blend right? This one is well made, and the main blender blade has 3 blades and will make quick work of anything you put in there. It's actually fairly quiet all things considered. Great product

Body: I bought one of these at a store. The blades were razor sharp and it served me me well for years before the motor started getting weak. I got the same one here. The blades were not that sharp and less than a year later the motor is getting weak and smells like it's starting to burn up.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: 8 months & cracked
Body: Main blender cracked after 8 months of very light use. Always hand washed, never put in the dishwasher.

Author: Jon miller
Title: Stopped working.
Body: I bought this blender in March and although it worked well until October, it has since stopped working altogether. The power turns on when it is plugged in but the blender does not work on any of the functions. I used it 4-6 times a week and cleaned it after every use.

Author: SaraIA
Title: 2 in one
Body: I’m thrilled with this blender! I wanted something to replace two appliances: blender and Magic Bullet. This is exactly that, except it’s better than both! I use primarily for smoothies and protein shakes.

Author: Linda Gordon
Title: Great Blender
Body: Great blender with lots of power!

Author: Anais
Title: Great blender!
Body: Noise is high but it does the job and it doesn’t bother me. Super quick and easy to clean.

Author: DW
Title: Shoddy craftsmanship, expensive replacement parts, poor customer service
Body: The blender blended food ok, but there's a tiny plastic flap on the lid that opens so you can pour out what you blend. That broke on my model and the company wanted $21 for an entire replacement lid (when all I needed was one small piece of the lid -- the most flimsy and breakable), which was 1/5 the price of the entire unit. I'm disappointed with both the product and the customer service. I spoke politely to 3 people in the parts and service department, and no one could do better. This is disappointing because the flimsy plastic part probably costs under a dollar for them to manufacture. I would not recommend this company for any product that you want longevity out of.

Author: Yolanda Osuna Bramstedt
Title: Great blender.
Body: I use this blender at least 5 days a week. It’s so powerful. I love the cup attachment for making one drink at a time. Easy clean up.

Author: JonB
Title: I would recommend this to anyone!
Body: I use this product to make smoothie bowls and it is just what I needed. My old Kitchenaid blender leaks and only has one set of cutting blades at the bottom while the Ninja had 3 sets. It has so much power and no matter what you put in, it is going to be blended!

Author: Steve
Title: Works Great
Body: Blades are super sharp in the blender. Id like if there was a way for them to lock in place even without the lid but other than that it works great.

Author: Donna

Body: This blender is the best I've ever used. And, for the money, you can't go wrong. I blend smoothies that an old blender could not handle. This one makes smoothies a breeze.

Author: gene dunn
Title: Strong
Body: Best blender i have ever owned

Body: We don't use it a ton, but when we do it grinds up everything we put in it. Both the large hopper and the individual cups work well for everything we have tried.

The 16 oz cups ended up too small to make anything reasonably sized, and for some reason no other sizes are available. The blender has made a strange burning smell from the beginning so not too hopeful on longevity.

Author: andre hall

Author: Bella
Title: Great price

Author: Bob
Title: Makes great smoothies

Author: bluejean
Title: A Blender Like No Other
Body: I've always owned a blender, but this is a blender on steroids. It turns ice into snow, it chops anything I put into it, smoothies are a dream, and powder added to juice is totally incorporated with no aftertaste. I don't know how I've managed without it for all these years.

Author: Janette Rodriguez
Title: Great product!
Body: I love making green smoothies with this! It blends everything perfect! Without any chunky pieces.

Author: Jennifer Ribarsky
Title: So much more well-designed than our old one
Body: Yes, it's very noisy, but I think it would be very hard to make a powerful blender that isn't. Does take some work to clean. Some moisture is getting inside the plastic handle, which is made of more than a single part. There is a pour spout you can pour out the contents without taking off the top. The top locks on, so it won't fall off while pouring. The blades are up to past the middle of the pitcher, so they hit all the contents. The blades are removable for cleaning. Seems pretty solidly constructed.

Author: T. Lloyd
Title: Not impressed after two replacement containers
Body: I bought my first one on June 8, 2019. After just one month of moderate use, making smoothies, the container cracked and was leaking. Ninja sent me a replacement container on July 19, 2019. It is now September 27 and this second container is cracked and leaking. I called Ninja and to replace the container they want $64.00 plus shipping. The entire unit is 99.99 on Amazon. So, they won't replace it a second time at no cost. I will not be buying Ninja products again.

Author: Tiff B.
Title: Not So Smooth Smoothies
Body: I'd like for the smoothies to be a little bit more smooth. I was not expecting the level of smoothness that one gets from the more expensive models, but I think this product could have ground up the smoothie ingredients just a little bit more. The capacity is very good. I've got to get use to the plastic pitcher which is very easy to crack. I miss my old one with the glass pitcher. The ice crushing power is good but not as good as the manufacturers make it out to be.

Author: Hatty
Title: Watch out for stress cracks.
Body: Stress cracks developed in the bottom of the large container after 2 years of modest use.

Author: Val Gooden

Body: As my title states, the clear plastic ring in the smaller, round blender piece comes out quite easily. In fact, I ordered this blender in July and the ring already came out and ended up blended into my protein shake...not the kind of protein I'm looking for, but thanks.

Author: Jay Wambaugh
Title: Works great
Body: Love it,makes great smoothies

Author: Christopher
Title: Excellent for smoothies, as good as a Vitamix
Body: We purchased this because of the two travel cups you can blend right in. Mainly for protein shakes. We love our vitamix but this is just easier to blend in the two travel cups and be on your way in the morning. Does an excellent job blending even leafy items like spinach. We use it for numerous things, soups, frozen cocktails, protein drinks, etc and it has been excellent so far and cannot beat the price.

Author: Ray
Title: Worth every penny and more.
Body: Do NOT cheap out on a blender. This ninja blender is worth every penny. I make a smoothie every night with these thing, putting everything from frozen fruit to greek yogurt to oats, it OBLITERATES it all. I've been blending in the 16oz cups as I don't need to make anything more, but I can say that the pitcher is also amazing having worked with a previous 1000 watt model.As for cleaning, you may need to be a bit thorough with the blade attachment for the 16oz cup (cleaning the blades carefully and the inside part that screws in the cup). Can be a bit difficult to clean, especially with big hands, but not to horrible.For noise, I will say it makes quite the racket, but if you put something to separate it from the surface you're using, it will at least cut down on the vibrational noise (if you have neighbors). Just be careful not to completely block the bottom ventilated part. Noise hasn't really been a crazy issue since I need about 10 seconds max of blending time (again, frozen fruit and the whole 9 yards).

Author: Priscilla
Title: It does a great job!
Body: I bought this for my daughter because I just love mine. She is now making dog food for her dogs instead of buying it because she wants to be sure of what is in the dog food. She was having trouble blending everything together. This blender took care of the problem.

Author: FreakyFoxxy

Body: Works very well for smoothies and cooked squash soup.

Author: Carlos Urdaneta
Title: Good
Body: Excelente

Author: Brittany
Title: Great blender!
Body: Very impressed. Blends ice and frozen fruit down to smoothie consistency. Love the mini blender cups, they blend just as great as the larger pitcher.

Author: Pam Stout
Title: Unable to fit container on base.
Body: I thought that I just didn't know how to place the container onto the base. However, when my entire family could not get it to work I believe the product is defective. The smaller containers work well, but seem to be showing wear. I don't use them often. I thought I was the problem, but it is the device that is a failure.

Author: david j matthews

Body: This is the second that I have owned and I am very pleased with it. Works well and cleans up well.

Body: This blender started cracking and leaking smoothie everywhere within 20 uses and 1 year of purchase.For as much as this blender costs you would think they could use plastic that won't start degrading within a year.

Body: After trying some cheap blenders and being disappointed, I was planning to get a vitamix, but I was holding off because of the price. I eventually decided to try this blender instead, and I'm very happy that I did. It can blend really big batches, and gets all the corners. The small single-serve cups are extremely powerful, and blend down anything in them to dust.I have been using this for the last 4 months and it has been working well. I made soups, smoothies, oat flour, and a bunch of other things. Haven't had any problems so far.

Author: Kathy Oryschak Desjardins

Body: I was initially very pleased with this purchase, but since then, I have become disillusioned with the single serve process. I use it daily and it is now almost impossible to use. The single serve cups get a flashing light and will not operate. I have tried everything and am about ready to give up. I really like the regular blender and have no complaints about that, but I am now in the ridiculous situation of having to use my Hamilton Beach single blender and Ninja full blender for things other than smoothies. Something has to go! Will likely be the Ninja :(

Author: Kate V

Body: This thing is powerful. Super sharp and strong blades. Seriously be careful because they will cut you with the slightest touch. Makes great blended smoothies and crushes ice to snow instantly.

Author: Matthew Hudson
Title: Worth the money
Body: Great for blending large or just blending some drinks. I have always bought cheap blenders and they could never get all the ice but this blender gets the job done in seconds.

Author: marv
Title: Great Kitchen Device.
Body: Very versatile and powerful.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love it
Body: Love it

Author: Annie Bear
Title: Died conveniently after warranty expired
Body: I bought this about a year ago. Use it multiple times a week. It's worked great....up until now. When to make a smoothie it just won't turn on. Checked to make sure it was the socket and it definitely isn't. Unplugged and replugged. Still no use. Checked my purchase date...of course, just over a year ago. I've learned my lesson when it comes to products like this. Will pay the premium for a better-made blender that lasts longer. Disappointed :/Also, this blender does not work for food processing - the blades are too far apart. Just fyi.

Author: Daniel c.
Title: Trash
Body: Total garbage. I bought this blender and the first big cup broke after 2 uses. Replaced andbwas extra careful this time. After 1 week it was coming apart at the bottom. Super glued the bottom until my vitamix came. Save your money vitamix is far superior and has a 10 year fill warranty not ninjas 1 year limited that doesnt cover components

Author: Andrea
Title: The best blender I’ve ever owned!
Body: From all the blenders I have owned in this price range, this is definitely my favorite and very much worth the money!It blends very well, it doesn’t get jammed up, food doesn’t get stack. Easy to use, clean and blends smoothly. The noise is just like any other blender, it’s powered by a motor so obviously it makes noise. Overall I recommend with no doubt!

Author: Myron Riemer
Title: Best blender for the price
Body: Best blender we have ever purchased.

Author: Elijah
Title: Powerful blender
Body: It is quite powerful, however it is also very noisy. It does tend to have some problems crushing larger ice cubes. Overall It works pretty well for the price.

Author: Kaden
Title: Best Blender Ever
Body: I've not stopped making smoothies since I got it. It's INCREDIBLY fast and powerful. It comes with two cups, which was perfect for me. The blending solution uses staggered blades, which creates a more even blend. There are only three issues I have with it:1) It is the loudest blender I've ever used (lucky it's so quick. 2-3 second full blends).2) The personal cup lids have to be screwed on tight or they'll leak.3) It's easy to cross-thread the single serving blades with the single serving cups and they're extremely hard to separate if you do that (One time I had to use a rubber mallet to get the threads lined up to unscrew them).Overall: I HIGHLY recommend this blender. I love it.

Author: Mdonald
Title: A mean machine- in a good way
Body: Perfect for our morning smoothies. We freeze all our fruit, add water, and almond milk the mix. This bad boy works great! The machine is much taller then our previous (cheap) blender. Our upper cabinets sit kind of low and so it won’t fit under the cabinet with the lid on, however it would not stop me from buying it again.

Author: B in CT
Title: Great at smoothies
Body: Really works well making smoothies. Kinda loud but it works.

Body: Making smoothies! Quick, delicious, nutrition for anytime of the day. It does the job as well as much more expensive blenders. Easy to clean up too. I am glad I got it.

Body: It’s great for smoothies and most of blending needs in the kitchen. The only thing is that it’s noisy when using the smoothie cups, and you can feel it twists a bit while blending you need to hold it.

Author: Daniel Hayhurst
Title: Awesome product at a great price!
Body: Easy to use! Extremely powerful also great price. I definitely recommend this product!

Author: hcurtis67
Title: Should be universal.
Body: Base should be universal. Cheaper tumblers

Author: Shannon White
Title: Best Blender
Body: Best blender I have used, blends frozen fruits in ice in seconds.

Title: Blender
Body: Great blender no problems at all

Author: Stephan Gray
Title: Def NOT NEW! used and damaged.
Body: This was not new! It was used! Looked like it’s been used and worn out, damaged and pieces already broke!!! I’m sure there was more terrible stuff to find but I didn’t get as far as opening any other part of it before taping it back up!!!

Author: Charlene M Davenport
Title: had to read the directions over a couple times, the blender works great and I would buy it again
Body: I liked that the blender was easy to use, and clean, I use it for shakes, and it works great

Author: hassan dasaet
Body: Excelente !!

Author: Cathy
Title: Don’t buy if you want to make smoothies.
Body: Developed cracks and broke. Thankfuly it was facing the wall or the large piece of plastic could have caused serious injury. Not recommended for smoothies as it doesn’t handle ice. Very disappointed as the selling point for this blender was its smoothie making ability.

Author: Sam Roberts
Title: Great blender
Body: Great blender. I'd buy it again.

Author: Hawkins
Title: Awesome.
Body: Great blender.....has no problems with frozen fruits

Author: victor lopez
Title: BEST APPLIANCE IN MY KITCHEN
Body: THIS IS THE BEST ITEM, NO NEED FOR A BLENDER AND PROCESSORALL THE BEST IN ONE ITEM

Author: Mark W.
Title: Good unit
Body: RPM could be faster. Good size blender cup.

Author: A.G.
Title: Amazing power house
Body: I have had a Vitamix for 12 years and needed a blender for a vacation house. I like this Ninja better than my Vitamix for making smoothies. I don’t have to tamp down stuff or stop and scrape. I have not used the single cup attachment yet.

Author: SR1997
Title: Smoothies!
Body: So we have made smoothies for breakfast most of the summer for 4 people. The power is great but it is loud. Cleans good and works great. I would buy again.

Author: mayra ceron
Title: Excellent
Body: I like for smoties

Author: D
Title: I would like another one but....
Body: I have had mine for almost seven years i bought at Target. And I never really had a problem until recently. One of the 16oz cups got chipped not sure how or when but it still worked until the crack in it finally gave out. but since it came with two just used that one until one day while blending myself a daiquiri a popped a whole pina colada went everywhere.I don't like the noise of it but it could have always been worse now that i have had one for so long. I want to buy a new one but i see other people are the same problem with containers breaking.

Author: T. Arthur
Title: Great blender. Needs bigger cups.
Body: Only complaint I have is that the cups are a tad on the small side. Need another 4oz if room or so. Otherwise this blender is a beast.

Author: Krista Maynard
Title: Ice Crusher
Body: crushes ice wonderfully. Love it!

Author: Danielle
Title: Powerful but noisy
Body: I love this blender. I’ve been using it every day for the past three weeks to make smoothies. I use a lot of frozen ingredients, such as frozen spinach, bananas and fruit, and the Ninja blends them quickly and smoothly.

Author: Don P
Title: Great versatile product
Body: Very sharp blades. Disassembles for cleaning. Cups are extremely handy for small blends, I've used the cups several times to blend spices and works well.

Author: Fabiola Avila
Title: Blends like crrazy
Body: So, i upgraded my blender from a regular old simple blender to this ninja... i even sometimes feel scared of using the level 3 button since i feel its suuper strong, but i love that now i can make perfect margaritas =)

Author: Oscar Alanis
Title: Best blender !!!
Body: it really blends my smoothies to highest quality!!!

Author: Jacob
Title: Super powerful!
Body: Super smooth smoothies!!!

Author: Jose Fuentes Portillo
Title: My blender
Body: I am enjoying my blender. It's doing a great job so far.

Author: Kindle Customer Ana Fleming
Title: This is garbage
Body: As a lucky MILLIONAIRE I can talk about blender this is pure garbage, those commercial that you see are nothing 6than Camara trick , up to now there is nothing compared to nutribullet that is a very good blender it polarize anything but in 10 year I have already but more than 20 they just stop working completely after many use I will stick to my nutribullet unti I find one that last I prefer one that work excellent and stop working when it can do the job at one that is garbage and don't blend nothing not even a piece of watermelon and ninjas blender are garbage they don't work good. Don't buy this trash

Author: Matthew
Title: No Customer Service
Body: It didn’t work right out the box. Tech support was not helpful. I understand that things sometimes happen but it’s the quality of customer service that speaks to a companies true quality. Don’t buy this product Ninja is not willing to help.

Author: tom p
Title: Loud but incredibly powerful
Body: I love this thing! It is so powerful, I have yet to find anything that it cant grind up for me. I make tons of shakes due to some health and digestive problems and this thing is a life saver! Totally worth the money. When this one dies I will replace it with another ninja for sure

Author: Keith S
Title: This is junk
Body: This is a junk plastic blender. The smoothie attachment cups sorta work, but only good for one person. If you need to make things for two+ people you need the standard canister. The 3 tiered blade system is garbage. You will end up giving it to goodwill in 6 months if you buy it like we did!

Author: Jenny
Title: IT does the job, easy to clean
Body: IT does the job, easy to clean

Author: TPF
Title: Don't bother - Large mixer does not work
Body: We use the small mixing cups daily, when we tried to use the large blender it did not work. It worked initially but now four months later it doesn’t. I checked the manual and it was no help. The manual specifies a red flashing light will appear if a safety is not set but our unit doesn’t power up at all.We install the blender and lid as specified in the manual but the power button doesn’t turn on at all.Loved it when it worked but frustrated for the lack of reliability.Update - I contacted Ninja and they sent out a replacement pitcher and lid but that made no difference. I called again to explain to them that the pitcher did not resolve the problem so they are sending a replacement base but they are charging me for the freight even though the unit is within the one year warranty period. (Really a scam because they added sales tax to the cost of the shipping so they are obviously taking the fee as sales revenue and not as expense).I have no faith that the blender will be reliable since they cannot even seem to diagnose it correctly. I would not buy this product again because the headaches are not worth it.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Happy
Body: Great blender

Author: Brittanie
Title: good but noisy
Body: Works wonders. But it is so loud. There's no way my husband can blend before work in the morning without waking up the house.

Author: Kris Buchan
Title: Love our Ninja
Body: Best blender I have ever owned. It blends everything I have put in it perfectly w/ easy clean up. It's nice b/c it has option for single serve for morning protein shakes too.

Author: Nevefam
Title: Love it!
Body: Love it!!! works great Love making smoothies in the cup size blender. It is on the noisy side, but blends great! Would definitely recommend it.

Author: fifth fox
Title: awesome machine
Body: i make smoothies with a ton of diff ingredients and before i used to have to strain out the chunks now there a. re no chunks. Its agreat machine

Author: FMG
Title: Used 12 TIMES then BROKE
Body: Mixed fine 12 times then broke... I have a Classic Beehive blender from COLLEGE and it still works MANY YEARS LATER... Ninja is PLASTIC PLASTIC PLASTIC… Didn't make it 9 months a complete disappointment... its a motor in a box and can't make it past 9 months... TOTAL GARGAGE!!!

Author: MBELLOMY
Title: Ice into snow in 5 seconds
Body: Ice into snow in 5 seconds

Author: Jeremy Pitre
Title: Works great
Body: Excellent product

Author: LNT in CA
Title: Good blender
Body: I love this blender. It's super fast and powerful. Easy to use. I think I use the individual smoothie making cups more than anything.

Author: Poco
Title: Put to the test. Excellent & priced right.
Body: Love that the top locks before you blend as I would’ve started it many times w/o the top. Works very well as I’m blending horse feed 6 times a day for two weeks so it’s getting out to the true test. Easy to clean & blender bland comes out. Twice it’s fallen into the bucket w/ the horse feed when I was emptying it. So that was a negative, I’m more careful now. Also to lock the top sometimes I have to hit it locked. No big deal after learning they trial & error.

Author: Richard Brown
Title: Has the stick thing built in, so fruit doesn't get pushed up the sides
Body: Has been perfect for my daily smoothies with frozen fruit. Also makes great milkshakes.The highest setting is very loud, probably too loud for midnight blending in an apartment. The first setting is quite strong too though, so if I am wanting to blend really early or really late, I use that and it takes a little bit longer.Smoothies and shakes best way to get all the gross supplement, and vegetable stuff in your diet. Like I cannot even use psyllium husk or pea protein or spinach unless its in a smoothie.

Author: Susie S.
Title: cracked after 1 week!
Body: after 1 week of having this blender, it cracked in two places. my last ninja lasted about 2 years before it cracked. I'm not sure why im having issues with my blenders but I'm definitely not impressed with this product!

Author: SR23
Title: Beware the sharp blade!
Body: We wanted to love this blender, but due to a poor locking mechanism the EXTREMELY sharp blade falls out very easily. It makes it a liability to clean and maintain, and at this point we don’t want to even use it anymore. Very disappointing.

Author: Erin
Title: Bought as gift
Body: I bought this for my parents to replace their old Kitchen Aid and they love it! My mom uses the individual ones all the time!

Author: Deb
Title: Great Blender but noisy
Body: We gave as a gift and they love it, but did mention the noise level.

Author: Cliente de Amazon
Title: Muy bueno
Body: Muy bueno

Author: MommyAlpaca
Title: Smoothie time!!!!
Body: It blends well. I use all frozen fruit and hardly have to stop to stir it up. Just make sure you add enough liquid to help with the blending. It's a bit loud but it's a blender so.....

Author: Frances Jaffa
Title: Wonderful and powerful!
Body: I was getting tired of having lumps of frozen fruit to chew through in my smoothies, so I bought this baby to help with that issue. Boy, let me tell you, I didn't know I could fall in love with a kitchen appliance. I use this blender daily. The single serving cups are perfect for my breakfast smoothies and the blender is powerful at keeping me from having to encounter frozen fruit lumps! I am SO in love and will recommend it to everyone I know!

Author: donghyeok heo
Title: Container breaks and leaks!
Body: I literally used it like four times, and now the container cracked and content is leaking. This is the third time that this has happened to me with ninja products. Never buy them again.

Author: 808person
Title: Doesn't purée very well
Body: I bought this to replace my Nutri-Bullet blender. The larger capacity is nice for the rare occasion when I want to purée a whole pot of soup, but it doesn't purée nearly as well as the Nutri-Bullet. Shakes and soups come out of the Ninja gritty and grainy, while they come out of the Nutri-Bullet perfectly smooth. After a few days I returned the Ninja and kept my Nutri-Bullet.

Author: B. Richard
Title: Has anyone else noticed this black stuff coming out of the bottom?
Body: We purchased this Ninja a little over a year ago.. on Amazon.. I was trying to write to Ninja about it, but do not see anything on their website or here that allows me to send an email with photo's, so I decided to just put it here and see if anyone else has had this happen.. again it's a little over a year old... I have moved it off this little cutting board often when I clean, but this time I saw this black ring on the cutting board, then when I touch the bottom with my palm it left this black mark on my hand.. the last photo is the bottom of the blender. It feels somewhat greasy. Not sure why it would do that this late after I purchased it? or if it is a sign of it breaking down? it still works, so far.. though I liked my previous Ninja much more.. we use it everyday.. the last one lasted a good 7 years.. this one just didn't bland as well as our older one.

Author: Bobby Koerner
Title: Good blender
Body: Little loud, but would recommend

Author: Shane
Title: Just as described
Body: Wife loves it

Author: Robert A. Anchundia
Title: Can't ask for more
Body: Perfect blender, very safe, no way to chop your hand with it's safety feature. Works excellent, price is great.

Author: Linda S.
Title: Best blender and smoothy maker I've ever had!
Body: Perfect, powerful, small or large jobs!

Author: Alexandra
Title: In Love
Body: This blender is amazing, Fast & powerful. I am able to make thick acai bowls, which I was unable to do with my other regular blender. Very happy with purchase! Bought on Prime Day and price was unbeatable!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Good
Body: good

Author: Michael Lynn Rardin Jr.
Title: Great quality
Body: Bought this ninja so I could blend protein shakes after workout and purée for soups. Absolutely love it!

Author: Alejandro De Faria
Title: Muy buena
Body: Me encanta ! Buen producto ! El hielo literalmente lo destroza

Author: JOSEPH GRANNAN
Title: I love this blender!
Body: I researched blenders for about 2 weeks and finally came back to my starting point. I love this blender so much. It works great. Now, I've only used to for my shakes, but it blends them up quickly and chops the ice up effortlessly to the perfect size. Yes, the blades are super sharp, so be super careful. I also bought the Amazon offered extended warranty. I hope and am sure that I will not have to use it.

Author: Buck Bowen
Title: Gravely disappointed
Body: I don't know how this has such high reviews. About the only thing this blender does well, and consistently, is disappoint. The blades might as well be tiny bats that hit your ingredients around, because they barely blend. The Total Crushing in the title must be referring to your spirits. Time and time again I go to make a smoothie, and if there's not a bunch of liquid, the blades just spin and nothing moves.I understand this is not a food processor, however, blending a frozen banana shouldn't be struggle.

Author: Sophie
Title: Best of the best
Body: such a great blender

Author: Katie and Matt
Title: Love!!!
Body: I'm obsessed with my new blender! I love that I can make single serve smoothies and take them with me. So far I've only used the single serve option, but I love the blending power of the Ninja. I've used an old Nutri Bullet and another hand-me-down blender for so long, and they never chopped up my frozen fruit, even after running the blender for a few minutes. I can run the Ninja blender for ...maybe 30-60 seconds, and it is fully blended and mostly chopped! The caps for the individual blender seal super well, haven't had any leaks so far. I also like how the bottom sticks to the counter, although I put mine in a cabinet so it's annoying to have to un-stick every time. It's very loud, but it's a blender so don't expect to be making smoothies while the baby is sleeping...

Author: Creig Bodily
Title: Make sure your life a little better
Body: Is blender is awesome, and I believe it might be one of the best on the market.

Author: JohnD
Title: Ice slicing technology
Body: Ninja Blenders are not marketed correctly. The blades are really sharp and they slice right through the solids instead of crushing the solids. This is why it never fully blends ice in your shake or smoothie. Also the attachments are cumbersome to wash and dry. The lid doesn’t always fit correctly on the center blade and wears out the retaining hole. I will never buy another Ninja Blender product again.

Author: shai
Title: too fragile!
Body: I've had this blender for a little over a year. It just fell off the kitchen counter and a whole part of the bottom came apart leaving the pitcher useless and sharp little shards of hard plastic all over the ground. I recommend paying for a higher quality blender that won't smash when it falls from just a few feet! Two stars because it did blend well when it was whole.

Author: Gerard M. Walsh
Title: A Powerful Blender with Useful Attachments
Body: It is easy to operate and clean. The pulse option breaks up ice cubes like magic and saves the main settings for blending.

Author: azriel tapias
Title: La batidora tiene poder para triturar.
Body: compre esta batidora primero por el precio que ofrecio Amazon, segundo por que ya habia usado una de esta marca y me gusto los resultados al liquar o batir mis jugos ,si me preguntan si lo recomiendo si, si lo recomiendo.

Author: Omar
Title: great
Body: easy to use and clean

Author: Thomas Clinch
Title: Great multi use blender, food processor
Body: The noise scares my toddler but otherwise it blends great. I’ve only had it a week and I’m so far happy with it. Parts go through dishwasher.

Author: CakeMom
Title: Not that great
Body: I had it for 1 day and returned it. Super loud and it didn’t even crush the ice.

Author: Felipe Rodrigues
Title: Great deal!
Body: We are very happy with the product. It has a good power and seems good quality.

Author: John Fairweather
Title: Mixes very well for the price.
Body: It’s not a vitamix. But saving so much money it still does a great job.

Author: Drew
Title: Good but loud
Body: Good blender, mostly use it for the single serve container for after workout protein powder shakes. The only drawback so far is that it is extremely loud.

Author: quillah
Title: Love this
Body: My husband and I love our Ninja blender. We make smoothies with it every morning for breakfast and it does an amazing job at blending frozen fruit and ice. Easy to clean, and I love the two bottles it comes with and ability to make individual shakes as well as larger portion ones. Highly recommend!

Author: khubs55
Title: Extremely dissatisfied
Body: Extremely dissatisfied with this blender. It did not stand up to my requirements.Majors cons:1. Extremely noisy blender. I haven’t had any which is so loud as this one.2. Doesn’t make fine paste. My basic requirements were to make chutneys and batter..unfortunately none of the jars (big and small) make fine paste. It has increased my work load to make batter. First I grind in big jar due to more volume and since it doesn’t make fine batter, I have to then transfer in batches to small jar which seems to help a little bit.3. Very difficult to clean. Esp the bigger jar where blades come off, there a big hole under the blade for it to fit in the jar. This home lodged lot of food and needs to be cleaned with straw cleaning brush3. Small jar, which can be used to carry smoothies have lids, but the spout of the lid doesn’t close. So can’t carry it to workI am looking to replace this ninja.

Author: Kristen
Title: Great blender
Body: Really awesome blender for the $$$.

Author: Sasha Overton
Title: Great product!!
Body: Love! Perfect for my daily harvest shakes!!

Author: Rocio Lopez
Title: We love are new Blender
Body: Cant believe we never bought this before we bought our Oster blender after 6 years. I wish I had known bout the Ninja. I am not a gullible person when it comes to those infomercials. My husband and I did some research before hand. We had original planned to purchase just the blender but with the individual smoothie cups it was a sweeter deal. We are so happy with our new Blender. Just becareful with the blades when you wash them.

Author: Melissa Hernandez
Title: Amazing!
Body: I've has this blender for almost a year now. It is very powerful and has been great for multiple things. I've used it for smoothies, food processing, grinding coffee beans, making whip cream, and more.It's also very easy to clean since the blade is easily removable. I love the suction under the blender as well. It helps it stay in place when in use.My onlyyyyy issue is that it is pretty loud. It's not abnormally loud for a blender, but there are definitely other blenders on the market that have a lower noise level.All in all, it's an excellent blender and is worth every penny. If you want a high quality blender that is not too expensive, this is it.

Author: Dave F.
Title: Great blender. Great value
Body: Great blender

Author: ClubFisher
Title: Power! Perfect Purchase!
Body: You all know how it is-- you read all the reviews, you go to different websites and then you finally decide THIS is going to be the one I'll buy... And I need to say I am THRILLED. I'm used to a little wimpy 300 horsepower motor so I'm feeling like Tim the Toolman with this one. It has such remarkable strength and speed and I personally think the sound level is okay. Of course if you are doing ice or larger nuts that initial chopping adds to the motor sound, but (without having any way to measure the decibels) I didn't feel like I should be wearing earplugs.And I also like the 16 oz cups that come with it. So far they are relatively stable, and I say relatively meaning they're a little bit taller and slim at the base, and for me it's easy to knock over-- but I haven't done that so far. But like the cup lip, it is comfortable to drink from.I happen to also like the feature that after you put the cup in place and turn-lock it on the blender (or pitcher) you first press the power button on, then make your selection. I like to that there's a single serving button so there's no guessing which blend do you want to do.The user manual is particularly slight but very succinct.and I have to say I only use the big pictcher once, and I love the way it clamp shut. and I'm a woman who follows directions so I only went up to the fill line never had any leaks or anything squirting out. And the pitcher pours nicely as well.I just think for the money it was a perfect, perfect purchase.

Author: H2theK
Title: Two thumbs up
Body: Works well for my needs. Doesnt crush seeds completely, but fir the price its excellent.

Author: J. Smithe
Title: Good blender with some flaws
Body: This is a very good blender. The thing holding it back is that it isn't as good as alot of the Vitamix or Blendtec blenders out there. The biggest distinction you'll find is in trying to make a smoothie with any seeded berry. The ninja simply won't grind the seeds no matter which setting you use. Meanwhile a same wattage Blendtec or Vitamix does. It's just odd and I think it's because the 6 blade assembly just isn't good for grinding.Now all that said, it still is a very good blender for the price but when you can spend just a little bit more and get a much better blender, it's hard to justify this.

Author: Matt B.
Title: Great for making daily shakes
Body: I make a shake for breakfast and this allows me to blend in a cup and go - cutting down on my clean up!

Author: Liz
Title: Pitcher cracked within 3 months of light usage
Body: I think I am finished with Ninja. This is my 3rd blender that has not laster 6 months. This time the pitcher cracked and it leaks.

Author: Gustavo lozada
Title: Awesome
Body: We've had lots of recommendations for this product. It is truly a great blender. Powerfull and easy to clean. Love it.

Author: Meagan Jones
Title: You won’t regret it!
Body: We love this thing! Have used it daily for almost two months. It is a little loud but great for protein smoothies with frozen fruit, veggies, etc. It’s made eating (drinking) healthy easy and quick for our family.

Author: Jesseco
Title: Wonderful blender!
Body: It took me a long time to replace my broken old blender. When I read negative reviews, I get scared to buy the product. I finally bought this one, and love it. I mostly use the small cups to make smoothies and shakes. I've had it a few months now and am very pleased.

Author: xlntgram
Title: Best Blender Ever
Body: Excellent blender....I recommend it for ice, and general blending.....becareful how you handle the blade. Its sharp!!!!!

Author: Avery
Title: Happy with the quality
Body: I waited several months to write a review after purchasing because I wanted to see if I experienced some of the issues other reviewers had. I have had no problems and it seems incredibly durable. I use the single cup size every morning. Very sturdy design and I like the suction cups under the motor that hold it to the counter. Yes it is loud, but it also easily and quickly blends everything I have tried in it. I had a Ninja previously that worked like a dream for 10 years until the rubber wore off the motor. It still works but the metal is exposed. I was hopeful this one would be long lasting as well. So far so good!

Author: Jared
Title: Terrible blender
Body: Terrible blender! The blade design sucks-just flings material everywhere no matter how it’s filled. And when things do get blended-it comes out very frothy and has tons of air in it! Terrible design, it has no way of pulling things in to itself to blend. The blades are dull. I’ve been trying to return it since I purchased it but my amazon app won’t allow me to... Primarily got it to blend shakes, and wasn’t really interested in the cups.But onto the cups! I started using these since the blender is so terrible and they work great! Blades are still dull! Always have to stop and clean the blades because material is stuck to the cutting edge which prevents the blades from blending. But I actual bought the Ninja IQ that uses just the cup-haven’t got it yet. But know how the cups work it’s a way better deal then spending almost $200 on the better ninja with the better blade design...

Author: glennn
Title: Pitcher cracked after 18 months
Body: Great blender, but 18 months in it started leaking through a crack in the bottom of the pitcher. Bad news---replacement pitchers are $60, when the completely new blender is $80.

Author: Tames
Title: Love the smoothie cups
Body: Fast easy to use powerful

Author: Steve LaPierre
Title: Works as expected
Body: The power is great. Noise level is loud.

Author: Michael Wilson Jr.
Title: Excalibur!!
Body: This product is inexpensive and a complete beast. There’s not really much it can’t handle

Author: Elayne
Title: The best ever
Body: Best blender ever

Author: stephanie
Title: BUY IT
Body: We just replaced our old Ninja blender which we had for 6 years and used multiple times a week...mostly for smoothies and salsa. We dropped and broke the lid a couple of years ago so it was time to replace. It was a great blender, so we decided to replace with a Ninja. We just bought this one over the weekend, and I am loving the single serve cups. So quick and easy and throw in the dishwasher. Our old one had a food processor attachment, which I was hoping would fit this base, but it doesn't. I probably used the food processor 4 xs, so I'm not really missing it. This is the absolute best blender for smoothies. It works 10xs better than the cheapo ones at blending frozen fruit. Its a little loud- it is a blender.

Author: Dick
Title: Close able lids
Body: Wish you were able to seal the top of the lids so nothing would spill out the top

Author: Beach girl
Title: Disappointing
Body: I had wanted a Ninja for a long time and was very happy to finally get one. However, I must say that I'm disappointed. I like to blend green smoothies and unfortunately this blender does not give me smoothies, more like chunkies. I make a detox smoothie with baby spinach, baby kale, green apples or pear, celery and a couple of other ingredients, the end result is always grainy, not smooth as a smoothie implies. Why is that? I thought it was damaged so I returned it and had it replaced but I still get the same results. Not happy.

Author: Elaine W
Title: Great smoothie blender
Body: I bought this blender for my daughter as a Christmas present last year and she loves it, so I decided to get on for myself. I started making smoothies and it blends everything in just a matter of minutes. I've read other reviews that say the blender is loud, I don't think it's loud at all and it's not hard to clean either. I would recommend this blender to everyone.

Author: nb3006
Title: Smoothie king
Body: Daughter loves it for smoothies

Author: Lydia Maness
Title: Great product
Body: All blenders are too loud.

Author: ekimogun
Title: easy to use
Body: food products

Author: Steve C
Title: Great Power
Body: The blender itself is great. The only issue I have is that it will only work with 16oz mixing cups unless you use the large blender pitcher. If I had known that prior, I would have purchased a lower priced or higher priced model.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love it
Body: Love just what I needed

Author: TinaE78
Title: Amazing and perfect
Body: Love this

Author: cynthia white
Title: Loves it
Body: Daughter uses a lotShe loves it
