Body: This guy is a beast. Easily takes care of frozen fruit to make smoothies!

Author: Andrea C.
Title: Awesome!
Body: Love mine!! No complaints.

Author: luu
Title: Love love love
Body: It’s beautiful, it’s smooth and it’s sleek! It blends everything so perfectly and the mini cups make it so much easier to drink my smoothies on the go. It’s my favorite purchase so far.

Author: AJK
Title: excellent product
Body: I didn't want to spend hundreds on a nice blender to make smoothies and shakes. I decided to try this out and have been so pleasantly surprised. I can't imagine any more expensive blender doing more than this does. Very happy with the quality and the easy of use and cleaning.

Author: lipa g
Title: Works great in very good price
Body: Love this item I use it for fruit drinks definitely worth the money

Author: Alejandro
Title: One Star
Body: Is broke in less than a month

Author: Caleb
Title: The blender itself works great and is easy to clean
Body: The blender itself works great and is easy to clean. BUT the handle has to be on the right side for everything to snap in and work properly. Being a left-handed person I HATE when products are for right-hand dominant. Yes, a little petty of me, but something to consider if you're a lefty.

Author: Stacy Emett
Title: I’ll be saving up to invest in a better blender.
Body: Got this for making smoothies (including green smoothies) and no matter what I do, I still end up chewing my smoothie. I’ll be saving up to invest in a better blender.

Author: vere*****
Title: Best blender
Body: Love my Ninja blender, best one I have owned yet.

Author: Dani
Title: Five Stars
Body: Will NEVER go back to a regular blender! NINJA NINJA NINJA.

Author: K. Bessette
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love it! Daily use.....Must have! Excellent Value!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love this blender!
Body: So great! I make smoothies with this a few times a week, and use with protein powder. It's awesome. The best part is the personal cups are super easy to clean. Have had this for 6 months, no problems so far.

Author: JLamb
Title: Love this blender
Body: This is a great smoothie maker. The blades go all the way up for efficient blending. The only problem is the ice must be smaller to drop in, unlike traditional blenders with the blades in the bottom. I would definitely buy again!

Author: Charles
Title: There’s no other blender better than this
Body: If your looking for a new blender this is a very affordable and very powerful this blender is probably the best blender I have ever had,I used to have a Westinghouse but it didn’t have the power for making smoothies the biggest difference is that this blender has single serve so if I don’t wanna make a big pitcher then I can make the small one and the 2nd difference is that the 72oz pitcher has 6 blades compared to the 2 blades on the Westinghouse blender the only thing I don’t like is that it’s very loud so if you have pets or baby’s then this is not the blender for you but if you want a very powerful blender then get this ninja

Author: Alice
Title: Jar not the best for this motor!
Body: Honestly I bought one and the jar cracks easily and fast!! Jr alone is 50.00 ! It’s a good blender but the jar is the best choice for a blender with this kind of power! The motor still works well. Blade on the other hand it’s dull a s jar all cracked !!! It’s very noisy but baby is afraid of it and covers his ears and or walks away from living room! Yes that loud!!!

Author: John Campanelli
Title: Five Stars
Body: works awesomely

Author: Tim Greyhavens
Title: Died after 3 years
Body: This is a great product - while it lasts. We used ours for lots of things - smoothies, milkshakes, soup - but only about 1-2 a week. It was extremely good every time we used it. But then after about 3 years it just died. No power, no lights, nothing. I tried it in multiple outlets, shook it, looked for any sort of fuse or anything that might have gone bad. Nope - it just died. I called the Ninja support people, and their only response was that once it's out of warranty there's nothing they can do. They offered to sell me another base unit, but that would cost $99.95 plus tax and shipping. I don't expect products these days to last forever, but 3 years is a pretty short lifespan for something this spendy. I doubt I'll buy one again.

Author: Aurora Maven
Title: Awesome Blender!
Body: I use this for juicing/smoothies. Been losing a ton of weight. At first there was a learning curve but that was more about the juice itself. The blender works awesome and its simple to use and easy to clean! Almost wish it was a little bigger but thats just me because I make large batches.

Author: Glen
Title: Five Stars
Body: Absolutely Awesome!!

Author: terry
Title: Love it!
Body: Used it a couple of times to make smoothies. It is awesome.

Author: Ken P
Title: Flimsy lid.
Body: After 2 years of light use the lid to the pitcher broke. The handle separates from the rest of the lid. I talked to Ninja and the only replacement is an entire pitcher assembly which they'll happily sell me for $65, about half the cost of the blender.

Author: Travel Enthusiast
Title: Easy to clean
Body: I use it to make protein shakes with ice. Crushes the ice thoroughly. Easy to clean. Very happy with this purchase.

Author: John
Title: Best Blender. Period!
Body: Purchased in 2011. They went all in. This machine sounds like what it does! Remember those crap blenders! The engineers made this sound like a rocket engine and it does a fine job! Will never buy another brand blender again! No cut corners on this blender!

Author: joe
Title: Not so durable
Body: Blends well, but after 8 months of light use. The rubber stoppers on the inside track and the tabs on the individual cups started to deteriorate.

Author: ThisIsNotMyRealName
Title: and the individual cups are super convenient for making single servings
Body: I use it primarily to make frozen margaritas and fruit smoothies. So far no problems, and the individual cups are super convenient for making single servings.

Author: Melissa Leek
Title: ... the second one I have purchased and am very pleased with the performance
Body: This is the second one I have purchased and am very pleased with the performance.

Author: rick
Title: I really like this product
Body: Use it daily

Author: John Doe
Title: Failed after 6 months
Body: I was given this as a birthday gift sent directly from Amazon. It was fine for the first 6 months but the motor burned out at the 6 month mark.

Author: Nancy Maguire
Title: Dangerous but can blend
Body: After having this item for over a year, both single serve cups have cracked while blending. It was really scary the first time it happened and since then I kind of shield myself while blending. The larger one works but came scratched and is a hassle to clean.

Author: The Dasha
Title: Bigger is not better
Body: I really liked the smaller ninja I use in our cafe, got the bigger one to handle larger orders and for the convenience of pressing the button and walking away and I’m rather disappointed. The small guy grinds up Flax no problem, not this one...leaves whole ones in a smoothie - no fun. It might sound stupid, but the big one won’t make you a single serve 16 oz smoothie, which is not what I was used to with a different professional brand.

Author: Rosie G.
Title: Died after 1.5 years of infrequent use
Body: So I'm writing a late review. I have had this product for about a year and a half now and it just died on me. Yes it worked great for a year and a half, but I think it's bologna to spend $120 for a product that will last for such a short period of time and I used it infrequently. I've had other brands last like a decade. Keep your old school blender, it'll last longer!

Author: dorian
Title: but works great so
Body: Makes a lot of noise, but works great so far

Author: gtx
Title: Awesome for smoothies
Body: Got this as a Black Friday deal ($40) and it was totally worth it. Blends ice like a charm and does it smoothly. Wish it was quieter but still a great quality blender.

Author: ELBGuy
Title: Great blender and a great price.
Body: FINALLY a blender at a reasonable price that actually works! It turns standard, ice-cube-tray ice into crushed ice without bogging down. Makes frozen drinks and smoothies perfectly. No cavitation requiring you to constantly stop and push the ingredients back down to the blades. The container and the top lock down so you don't need to hold the blender while in operation. The travel cups work great from making morning grab and go smoothies with no blender clean up required.

Author: JP's
Title: Great!
Body: Bought this to make boba smoothies at home- used it 4x and it’s perfect. We’ll see how long blade lasts.

Author: Melissa Wakefield
Title: Awsome!
Body: Love it to death. Powerful and easy to clean.

Author: Bosh
Title: Great product
Body: Very strong and the small cups are very handyEasy to wash in dishwasher

Author: E. Maillet
Title: I would not recommend this product
Body: I would not recommend this product. We purchased it and were happy with it for... half a month, when the motor broke and then the silicone insert for the blade attachment broke. We are not forced to return the entire thing and get a refund. I would recommend purchasing a higher quality blender if you are looking for something that will last.

Author: LSJ
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great purchase. Use it daily to mix protein drinks.

Author: Kent
Title: This blender is a must have...
Body: This this is the truth... makes blending smoothies a breeze...

Author: Robyn Eaves
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love it!

Author: SDM
Title: Four Stars
Body: Too loud and I wish some of the to go cups were glass

Author: LMT/mom of 4
Title: Love this
Body: Love this blender. So easy to use and clean. Mixes up whatever very thoroughly. Plus the individual smoothie cups - brilliantI've not personally used a vitamix so I can't properly compare. But I don't care. This ninja works better than anything else I've used and have had no issues with its performance and can't beat the price

Author: RoBoCo
Title: Noisy but good
Body: Like the reviews say, this is loud. But it is good. The 2 individual glasses are great. If you don't want to spend $300 for a blender or replace the $40 retailer blender then this is the one you want.

Author: Fred
Title: I didn't order a used item
Body: This blender was obviously broken and repackaged. Now that I took it out of the box I feel I'm stuck with it. I'll never buy anything that's not in the original box and looks like a 5 year old taped it up! It is disturbing that you let a product out the door looking like that! I should have just refused the order.

Author: Scooter Reviews
Title: Great for protein shakes
Body: I like it! I had a Ninja Blender that lasted 4 years, but it wasn't professional grade like this one. I make 2 protein shakes a day- waking up and right before bed. I throw a shaker cup of water in the blender, add 3 scoops of protein powder, add a cup of raw spinach, and BAM! Breakfast is served. This is the ONLY thing I use it for so keep that in mind for this review. But for the shakes it is perfect! I've looked extensively at the more expensive blenders, but this one is reliable and does the job well. Great bang for the buck.

Author: HalLew
Title: Can’t say enough good things about this blender
Body: Absolutely LOVE this blender! We had a glass Breville blender before, it was bulky and hard to clean, didn’t blend very well and made a mess. This blender in the few days we’ve had it has been my favorite purchase of the year! My husband and I make smoothies daily so the individual cups with blade are so helpful! It blends anything and everything you’d want to put in a smoothie very well! Greens which can be tough blend so easily! Highly recommend!

Author: HappyShopper
Title: Fun for drinks of all kinds
Body: Amazing...ice shredded in seconds.Used at high School prom mocktail bar. So great I ordered one that night.

Author: hill3
Title: Great smoothie blender
Body: Great blender. We primarily use it on frozen fruit for smoothies and it does and excellent job. Square base keeps things from bunching up at the bottom and the blades at different levels gets everything blended very quickly.

Author: another pretty face
Title: Works great!!!!
Body: I haven’t had any issues with this product. It works great. We have made lots of smoothies and we have used the blender part a lot. Great product!

Author: C B
Title: Too huge for apartment use
Body: Did not like! Edges seemed cheaply made. Way too huge.

Author: Rhonda C.
Title: I am very disappointed.
Body: I purchased this item as a wedding gift in September of 2017. The bride informed me that it stopped working suddenly this week without any warning or any sign of trouble. (stopped working June of 2018) To use the warranty she would need to send it back in its original packaging along with the original receipt. Needless to say She does not have the original packaging or receipt. I am very disappointed.

Author: Gee Gee
Title: Returned.
Body: returned. changed mind.

Author: tommybally
Title: Better than Kitchenaid and cuisinart In my opinion and way faster!!!
Body: I’ve always wondered about these Ninja blenders. After my kitchenaid failed I decided to buy one of these and at a better price than found locally. Both the Kitchenaid and cuisinart brands have let me down with their blenders, food processors and mixers. They only appear to be quality on the outside but the mechanicals and motors are so far behind technologically speaking once you open one up. It upsets me to see the price that is being charged for 1960s era technology in a new wrapper.

Author: S. Nowak
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love everything about this

Author: pen_name089
Title: This blender is perfect. It makes great margaritas
Body: This blender is perfect. It makes great margaritas.No chunks of ice..like other blenders that can't hold up to the simple task of getting every bit of ice blended up.We make smoothies and mixed drinks all the time..it has never failed us.

Author: Littlebit
Title: Works great!
Body: I love it. It makes making healthy smoothies a breeze. Blades are very sharp though. So be careful when washing the big blades

Author: Brenda Liu
Title: Great shopping
Body: Good quality! Since it was there, there are delicious juices every day, and it's easy to use

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Very sharp
Body: Works great be very careful because the blades are extremely sharp, I cut myself pretty bad. But the single cups are great for smoothies.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: works great

Author: Invincible4ever
Title: Works
Body: Works as advertised/described

Author: iamrosita
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love the blender. Very powerful for the price. Great for smoothies.

Author: Angel
Title: Absolutely perfect!!!
Body: I’ve gone through three Nutibullets because I was told they were the best! So wrong! The ninja is just amazing! I LOVE that you don’t have to push down on it like the Nutribullet and it doesn’t leak like the Nutribullet! I am in love! I’ve used it every day now and I am so happy!!!

Author: Stack⠀Overflow
Title: I love the triple layer of blade design because they help ...
Body: This worked very well for me. I love the triple layer of blade design because they help to get to stuff sitting on top of the carafe. On regular blenders with bottom-only blades, you have to ensure you have enough liquid to enable the blades on the bottom to draw the contents on top to the bottom where the blades can get to them. With the triple layer blade design, the blades get to the contents in the middle and top even when your liquid levels are low.------------------------------------------------------------IMPORTANT NOTE ON THE BLADES------------------------------------------------------------There are TWO SETS of blades (one for the carafe and one for the mugs). The blades are EXTREMELY SHARP!!!!! I got cut while I was unpacking this unit. BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU'RE UNPACKING/HANDLING THIS UNIT.I've never had the very reputable Vitamix and Blendtec blenders, both of which cost 5 times as much as this Ninja, so I can't compare the Ninja to these. But from hearsay, the Vitamix and Blendtec do blend contents into finer bits. For those into liquid nutrition, this might be a big deal, because the finer blending is supposed to release more of the nutrients. Personally, I'm skeptical of this supposition. I need a blender mainly for smoothies and for this purpose, the Ninja does a fine job. No unblended bits or chunks in my smoothie, like a smoothie should be -- smooth!The caveat to this post is this my opinion is from < 1 week of use, so I can't speak to the durability of this product. Another caveat is I've only done fruit smoothies on this; I don't know how it performs on crushing ice. Additionally, there have been a sizable number of reports that the carafe and mugs crack either inexplicably (doubtful) or in the dishwasher (more likely). Worst comes to worst, you can buy replacement carafe or mugs, although they're not cheap (around 30.00 - 40.00 for the carafe, I think).I don't think I've read any reports of the motor breaking. This is very good news!If anything were to break, this has a 1 year warranty. (FYI: Vitamix and Blendtec have warranties of 10 and 7 years (!), respectively.)---Overall, I think this unit is a good bet if you're strapped for cash and need a reasonably priced and decent blender. If money is not an object, I'd recommend the extremely reputable Vitamix.

Body: It's great. Blends ice instantly and it's pretty much idiot-proof. The only problem is it's hand-wash only and I sliced my hand on the blades while trying to clean it. But at least I know the blades are sharp!

Title: The smoothest smoothies, in seconds!
Body: Oh I do love this blender!!! Make the smoothest smoothies in seconds! I am thrilled with my ninja! The only thing I would change is the size if the cups. I would prefer a larger cup and a sealable lid to drink from. The ones that come with it just have holes in them. Big enough to use a reusable straw with too. I can't wait to make my next smoothie!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Does the job with a lot of power!
Body: I like the blender and the (2) smoothie jars. There's lots of power here and the blender container has a lot of space. No problem with leaking around the base as with my previous brand, and no more stopping to push ingredients down toward the blades. A couple of drawbacks for me: you can't add anything while blending. Even opening the small pour hole creates spray out of the blender. The lid will only fit in one orientation and the smoothie containers, plenty large for a drink for one person, had trouble incorporating ingredients like greens quickly.

Author: dion wilson
Title: We had an older Ninja model that work pretty good for about a year
Body: Wow. My Wife has gone to town using this blender to make our smoothies. We had an older Ninja model that work pretty good for about a year . I think we should have lasted a little longer but the turn and lock in place in order to start the motor feature gave out on us. I hope this one doesn't end up doing the same. Although this one has a full pitcher w/handle it still turns and locks to start. So far so good. It works like a charm. blends very well almost to well unless you like your smoothie more like juice. I like it, the Wife loves it.

Title: When making shakes it does not crush nuts to a fine powder well
Body: Does not crush nuts to a fine power quickly.Certainly powerful enough to get the job done. But the blades do not create enough of a mixing action to crush nuts and other smaller solid pieces into a fine power. The result is a a shake with chunks of almonds etc... rather than a smooth shake.The small cups do that well. But those are too small. And they don't offer a blender with a large pitcher, and the kind of blade that they have in the small cups. Why not?!Bottom line: My picky GF is now nagging me to buy a $550 major brand b.s. device after spending $125 on this one.

Author: GMH
Title: Plastic pitcher cracks and leaks
Body: UPDATE: Buyer beware! Bought replacement pitcher that cracked within 30 days! This item doesn't even deserve one star. It's a piece of junk. I just can't understand how Ninja can make such a great base unit and then pair it with this awful, plastic pitcher. Stay away from this product.I have owned my Ninja BL660 for 6 months. I use it 3-4 times per week and always hand wash it. As far as blending goes, it's amazing but the quality of the pitcher is awful. After 5 months, I started to notice hairline cracks in the base of the pitcher. A month later and it's leaking all over. I called customer service who told me that the warranty does not cover the pitcher and the replacement pitcher is $65! Why this machine has a plastic pitcher is beyond me and to not cover it under the warranty is ridiculous. You can purchase the replacement on Amazon for $39 but I'm not interested in spending $40 every 5 months!

Body: While it blends very well, the handle of the carafe broke after just a few months, and with seldom use-I use the single serve cups daily- the handle is now broken and prevents the top from latching, so it is now useless.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Worked fine for two years, leaking in the second year, black tarry mess inside of the blender, no power anymore now
Body: I bought it on February 24, 2016, and used it almost on a daily basis for more than two years. I have been using the Ninja cups most of the time to make vegetable juice (e.g. blending apples and carrots). It did a good job blending some hard-textured vegetables like carrots. However, the cups started to leak during blending since last year. I thought it was because I had been using one cup for too long, so I changed to use the second cup which worked. But there had been always some black tarry mess inside of the blender, which sometimes I worried that it would enter my juice through leaked blender lid. Last week, when I tried to make the apple and carrot juice I had been making for years, the blender cannot be turned on anymore. No red light was on. After excluding the possibility of no power and misalignment of the cup to the machine, I was left with no choice but giving up. It was sad that this blender no longer worked and I did not know what went wrong. Nevertheless, the overall product has been fine to me in the past two years.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: So happy with this blender
Body: So happy with this blender, I was looking at it for awhile and finally decided to get it and it was worth it. It crush ice to slush instantly and blends everything so fast love it. I love that it came with two single serve cups, what I did not like is that it was deliver in the original box that says “Ninja Blender” not in an Amazon box which was upsetting because anyone could have stolen it when it was left on my front porch. It also did not come in white and block box that most of the Ninja blenders come in because of that I thought maybe it was not brand new, but I spoke to Amazon who ensure me that is how Amazon received them from the company and everything looked brand new with , I also wish the cord was more easily stored you have to keep pushing it in, I wish it had a button to just reel cord in. Anyway if you are thinking of buying the Ninja go for it you won’t be disappointed. I’m giving it 4 stars because of the way it was delivered and because of the chord but other than that I’m very happy with it.

Body: I know there are a lot of great reviews about this blender. This is why I purchased it. Perhaps then my experience is a rare one, but you never know. It appeared that the lid was no longer aligning with the little snap piece to lock in place. The blender would not function absent the lid being locked in place. Also, perhaps it is my own clumsiness, but that blade is way sharp. I cut myself on it two times in the two days I used it. They were seriously deep cuts. Be careful around this blade! Author: Em T
Title: Fruit Ninja complicates what could be an easy solution...
Body: The blender works well, but the company is awful. I primarily use the single use cups with the small blender and it does the job.. But, good luck trying find a replacement gasket for the smaller blade. The company intentionally does not sell this part, you instead have to buy the entire blade again. I know this, because I called the company and asked for the part or a part-number to buy it from a third party. And just so you know, the small blender cannot function without plastic gasket. But here is the problem, because the plastic ring seals in the liquid, it get's gross. So logically, you need to wash it. After I had washed it, my partner accidentally thought it out. Hence my dilemma. Instead of being able to buy a plastic ring that would cost a few dollars, I am stuck with having to buy a new blade $20. This is 20% of the cost I paid to buy the blender. Not to mention how wasteful it is... Yuck fruit ninja, get your priorities straight.

I also just made pulse salads for a few days worth of lunches and it only took me 15 minutes instead of me usual 30-40 with our food processor. And homemade Russian dressing was a breeze too. The Ninja is so easy to clean as well. Most everything rinses off with my sprayer and I just wipe it with our scrub brush just to clean it a bit with soap. You can put everything in the dishwasher, but I prefer to hand wash since it’s so quick and easy. I would definitely recommend this if you want an easy way to pulse anything or make smoothies.

Author: D. Aks
Title: Great value, perfect for shakes and smoothies. BE CAREFUL OF BLADES!!!!
Body: I haven't had a blender in many years. About six months ago I started a new health and exercise regimen...determined to feel and looking better by making small steps every day. I eat a lot of fresh fruit and veggies like avocado, kale, bananas, etc. I decided a couple months ago that it was time for the next step...healthy, clean smoothies! I was a little lost on where to start, and trying to figure out if I wanted to splurge the extra couple hundred dollars for a Vitamix or if a Ninja would do the trick.I am glad I saved the money and went with the Ninja. Although I'm sure if you use the blender for a lot more than smoothies and for really rough food items a Vitamix could be a great investment - but for smoothies? This is perfect for me and I don't possibly see how they could taste better. I love how this comes with two cups so that you can make single-serve smoothies without all of the huge mess of using the big blender. I mostly only use this for single-serve smoothies, so I haven't touched the big one in a long time.WARNING - please be warned that the blades are EXTREMELY sharp, and I do believe that Ninja should alert you to this more while opening. While opening the package, my husband literally sliced his finger open. He hates going to the hospital so stitched it himself...but it was serious, probably about 6 stitches worth. It was a massive gash and the packaging doesn't warn you about it at all. I read another reviewer said that when her husband opened it the blade was loose and literally fell on his food and he had huge lacerations and had to go to the ER. So it's nothing to mess with. I was actually kind of terrified of the blender for a short while after it happened, but it's fine now...just be careful!The SINGLE-SERVE is really the life-saving part of this. Here is my absolute favorite smoothie recipe:Banana Peanut Butter Yogurt Smoothie1/4 cup water3-4 ice cubes1 banana3/4 cup of yogurt (I prefer the new Oui French Yogurt by Yoplait. One glass container is exactly 3/4 cups).Pinch of cinnamon1 tablespoon organic peanut butterOptional: ice cream (if I'm in the mood) or a half a scoop or scoop of protein powder after a particularly hard workout. Make sure when you make smoothies to put THE SOFT STUFF on TOP! I used to put the ice last on the top and it takes like 10 times as long to blend. Sounds really obvious, but I totally was not thinking at first. In about 30 seconds or less your smoothie is absolutely perfect. I have zero problems with it. It's totally smooth, delicious, and the cups are really easy to clean and I love the lids.I am so happy with this purchase. If you are a gourmet chef and are blending things constantly for dinners a Vitamix may be for you...but for basic things, like smoothies or shakes? This is perfect and I'm so glad I chose this one.

Author: Anonymous
Title: this blender works fantastic. It has 6 VERY SHARP blades and will ...
Body: Wow, this blender works fantastic. It has 6 VERY SHARP blades and will blend just about everything. I mainly use it to make smoothies. But overall, this is a great product.

Body: Bahaha. It blends everything. Awhile back I tried a typical style blender and had to open it up and push stuff down constantly. That's not an issue with the design of the ninja. I love the cups for smoothies, and I use the big blender for salsa. One downside is you can't really make chunky salsa since it turns everything into liquid (even apples) on the lowest setting (I actually love this, though). It's easy to clean and holds up well. My one complaint is that you may want to keep ear protection nearby--it's really loud.

Author: Kelsey Brooks
Title: Five Stars
Body: Best. Blender. Ever.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not the best on the market
Body: It works okay. Not the best on the market. I do like the 2 individual cups but I would have just ordered a small blender for smoothies because I find myself trying to push the items down and still not fully blended.

Author: Admini Strator
Title: This blender is great for chopping
Body: I wanted to give an honest review. This blender is great for chopping. However, it does not make great smoothies or frozen drinks well at all. The blades are sharp, but it chops ice into small chunks rather than smooth. I had to get a Vitamix in order to get the results that I was wanting. If you want a great chopper, then this blender will do fine. If you want smoothies or frozen drinks, then this is not the blender for you. You should also know that this blender will not tolerate hot liquids. So, that is a problem if you want to purée hot soups.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I urge you, do not purchase!
Body: As a vegan/ plant based eater and an athlete I make a lot of post workout smoothies and snack smoothies to get my nutrition in for the day, I urge you please do not buy! Blades dull after a few uses and Ninja does not stand behind their blades. If you like to chew your smoothies and swallow chunks then maybe you would like this blender... but still probably not.

Author: Mr. Kotula
Title: This thing is a beast
Body: I needed a new blender, so I tried this when it went on sale. I am not disappointed, even a little. I make breakfast smoothies four or five days a week now. It cuts through the frozen fruit and I've like nothing. I'm glad I bought it

Author: Deborah Manley
Title: Two Stars
Body: The blenders okay my old one actually Blends up the spinach in my smoothies finer

Author: Rick
Title: Four Stars
Body: The package wasn’t handled with care but overall a good blender.

Author: David Brown
Title: A blender on steroids.
Body: This thing is crazy good compared to normal blenders.

Author: Josh Kaiser
Title: Powerful.
Body: Just bought this. So powerful.

Author: Faith Hooper
Title: Small cups, great machine
Body: The cups are small and there is no other option. Otherwise, fantastic

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Four Stars
Body: It is nice blender but other buttons arent working.

Author: Daniels Mom
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love this blender! Very powerful and easy to use.

Author: Kristeenie
Title: Painfully loud, mediocre at blending.
Body: We just returned this blender because it was seriously the loudest blender I have ever encountered, and it didn't even do a very good job blending. It's loud because it has a dual-speed spindle to accommodate both the large jug and the to-go cups, so there's some sort of gearbox inside, rather than most blenders that are just direct drive. Even with absolutely nothing in the blender, it is loud enough to wake up the kids on the second floor, and make your ears ring after turning it off. I suspect it would give you permanent hearing loss if you used it every day.On top of this, the smoothies are not very smooth at all. A simple smoothie (including strawberries, blueberries, and spinach) blended on 3 for about 60 seconds came out gritty with visible flecks of spinach, and a whole spinach leaf somehow escaped being blended at all.I would stay away from this blender. I could forgive the mediocre blending if it didn't sound like someone was revving a motorcycle in my kitchen.

Author: Asinvera
Title: Perfect blender, the best smothies ever
Body: Perfect blender,the best smothies ever!!!

Author: Bradley
Title: it's a good blender. It does as well as my $20 ...
Body: Honestly, it's a good blender. It does as well as my $20 Oster blender that I used previously. But for the money, I guess I was expecting something better. In my opinion, it may not be worth the money, and if I know what I knew now, I'd probably just still use an Oster brand.

Author: Stephen
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great blender. Wife and I love it, and kid always wants a smoothie!

Author: Jared B.
Title: Went through a couple cheaper versions and I wish I ...
Body: Went through a couple cheaper versions and I wish I had just done this one to start with. No readjusting the contents, no stopping and starting, it just does it's job no matter how much ice it has to crush.

Author: Constance
Title: Almost petfect
Body: This is fantastic. Strong motor. Makes a good smoothie for me.I do wish the cups had a way to close the lid. Is just an opening. No slide to close lid.

Author: Cindy B
Title: Best Blender for Fruit Smoothie!
Body: Love the blender for fruit smoothies. Be careful when cleaning blades... very sharp!

Author: Darren
Title: Five Stars
Body: This thing is awesome and then some. Crushed ice with a breeze!

Author: D. Edwards
Title: which seems like higher quality plastic and the rim is thicker
Body: Replaced an older Ninja with this when the pitcher on the old one cracked, and found out the new pitcher would be about $80. This one has a nicer design to the pitcher anyway, which seems like higher quality plastic and the rim is thicker, which is where the stress cracks developed in the original. Wish I hadn't had to but a whole new set, but that shouldn't detract from the assessment of this one.

Author: Olizia Ortiz
Title: Five Stars

Body: This product motivates me to make kale protein smoothies every day due its ease of use. I hardly did in the past because of the hassle of cleaning my old school blender. If you are an athlete, this product will help you get the nutrition you need.

Body: I would have given it a 5 star but it's really loud. But it is super powerful.

Body: Love all the attachments but this thing is loud af. Plus the blades bent a little already from making smoothies. It works and I guess it’s pretty decent for this price.

Author: vger94
Title: Works great at making smoothies in the blender
Body: We received this product yesterday and finally took it out of the box today. Works great at making smoothies in the blender. We bought from Amazon Warehouse and it was missing some pieces, Amazon replaced them. Wife is happy.

Author: Donna Fleischman
Title: Ninja needs to work on this but otherwise it’s amazing. It gets used 4-5 times a day at ...
Body: We ha e had our blender for 2 years. We have had to replace the blade (part that you screw into the bottom) twice. Hey are expensive$30 each. This last time the blade doesn’t seal in a few of our cups- it does seal in our older 2 cups (but not the newer ones). Ninja needs to work on this but otherwise it’s amazing. It gets used 4-5 times a day at our house and everyone loves it.

Author: R.B.
Title: So far so good
Body: So far so good, no issues, easy to use, easy to drink out of the cups, and can even use large size straws with the cups.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: good product

Author: Vishal Patel

Author: Addy Hurst
Title: This is a fine blender except for the top of the large blender
Body: This is a fine blender except for the top of the large blender.The top of the blender broke almost immediately and is extremely annoying to mess with every time you want to use the large blender. I like the single use blenders but using the large blender is frustrating 100% of the time because of the horrible design job of the lid. It is very tight fitting and if you tug on the handle at all, the entire top portion of the lid will break away from the bottom portion and it will not operate correctly. I looked to see what the replacement cost would be for the lid. They are very pricey. Giving it 3 stars because I do like the single serve blending options.Just FYI.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Overall the blender is good though.
Body: The shake bottles are kind of small. Overall the blender is good though.

Author: RG
Title: AFTER 1 YEAR AND 1 MONTH THE TOP BROKE. IT HAS VERY WEAK PLASTIC PIVOTS FOR THE UNLOCK" FUNCTION AND IT COSTS $50 TO BUY AND SH"
Body: AFTER 1 YEAR AND 1 MONTH THE TOP BROKE. IT HAS VERY WEAK PLASTIC PIVOTS FOR THE UNLOCK FUNCTION AND IT COSTS $50 TO BUY AND SHIP A NEW ONE. I use it 2-4 times a week and am careful not to abuse it. The rest of the machine is holding up well and does a good job.

Author: Guy
Title: Very sturdy, love the different features and its not over ...
Body: Very sturdy, love the different features and its not over developed with too many settings that the normal user will use.

Author: Ph03n1x
Title: This blender is easy to use and effective
Body: This blender is easy to use and effective, especially for the price. I use the single serve cups all of the time and have had no issues.

Author: calfin
Title: Four Stars
Body: works great for smoothies!!

Author: Chris
Title: Decent Blender for the price, but not a fan of the stacked blade design.
Body: It seems to work well, but I am not a fan of the stacked blade design. The stacked blades make it more difficult to stir the mixture and it is slightly more difficult to clean. As a result I will probably use the single serve cups more often since they are much easier.

Author: ajnewengland
Title: It has some problems...
Body: I use my blender daily and here is what I found after a week of use. It makes a nice smoothy but not unless you open it several times during the cycle to scrape the sides. The locking cap is nice but it collects water inside when you wash it. I made pancake batter this morning and when I poured the batter into the pan the water dripped, hit the hot oil, and splashed it on my hand - ouch! I also noticed water and condensation in the handle. I know it is just water but is this a potential bacteria growing problem - scary thought. It wasn't cheap so I did expect better quality. I also found it difficult to hand wash. I will need to buy a different cleaning brush/ sponge to get into the bottom. Overall it does blend stuff nicely. My smoothies do not separate even after many hours in my lunch bag or refrigerator. I think I am returning this as the bacteria thing scares me.

Author: Tonya Montgomery
Title: I use it daily
Body: Use this almost daily. I have yet to use the big pitcher, however daily shakes and protein shakes, you can't beat the small pitchers and blender. Lots of power and good quality.

Author: Jane Hauber
Title: Design flaw
Body: How does food get INSIDE the handle? It appears you need a screwdriver to get the outer piece of the handle off. This isn't something you can do often or you'll strip the tiny screws. This seems like a leaking issue and a gross one at that.

Author: KG1
Title: Fantastic Blender
Body: Works great, but noisy. Still the best blender I have used.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: great

Author: NJ

Body: The Nutri Ninja cups stopped working after just one use. The blender motor is very loud, you may not be able to use it at night without disturbing the neighbors! I'm disappointed with the purchase.

Author: David L Klassen
Title: Five Stars
Body: Met all expectations

Author: Kay
Title: THE PITCHER CRACKS!!!
Body: I wanted to love this thing...the reviews are great, the commercials are great, some even say it's about as good as a Vitamix. So I bought one, only to be using it [per manufacturer instructions] and for a piece of frozen fruit to be hurled into my face while cracking the pitcher!I called the company to complain, and they sent a replacement pitcher (which I had to wait 4 weeks for), only to AGAIN have a pitcher crack on me!SAVE YOUR MONEY! Buy something that won't crack!

Author: cameramike
Title: Great blender.
Body: like it a lot. Use everyday.

Author: andrew
Title: received feedback and works great. Very powerful
Body: Bought as gift, received feedback and works great. Very powerful.

Author: Michael Olsen
Title: I’ve used the magic bullet for so long and dealt with poor chopping and didn’t realize until we got this
Body: Wow.. I’ve used the magic bullet for so long and dealt with poor chopping and didn’t realize until we got this. I am now able to make smoothies that are not ice chunky and just like professional smoothie joints. Super pleased and have used daily for several months with zero issues. It’s loud but come on.. all are and if you want a blender that works this is the one.

Author: Walt
Title: Saving me lots of money on frozen coffee drinks.
Body: I use the drink cups several days a week. Six to 8 large ice cubes, a packet of instant coffee, a packet of Splenda, a tablespoon of French Vanilla creamer and fill the rest with milk and presto - $3.50 saved. (And really good, too.)

Author: Preston lg
Title: For smoothies and protein shakes you can’t beat it. ...
Body: For smoothies and protein shakes you can’t beat it. It turns ice to dust in seconds! You can make shakes directly in the included cups, no more waiting for a single use blender to be washed to make another shake. I just ordered 2 24oz cups for 17.50. Replacement blades also look to be really affordable if you ever need them.

Author: Rolander O.
Title: Five Stars
Body: This blender is Awesome

Author: lady in the pines
Title: It will crush ice but I don't like to push it
Body: This is one tuff little blender. It holds up. It will crush ice but I don't like to push it. The bearings have held out well and the blades stay sharp.

Author: animals
Title: 98% good
Body: I've had a Ninja for 8 years. When the bowls broke off parts they were replaced. I love this blender but two things wrong. The handles get food or some kind of white gook in there and I can't get it out. Use it in the dishwasher and wash it in the sink. The rubber on the lids get crumbly and leave rubber pieces over the top of the bowl. (In the food, do not know.) It works great, but because I dropped the bowls at different times, pieces on the bottoms broke off and now won't work in sitting on top of the base motor and it won't hook on to start it. . The base is no longer made, so I doubt if I can just buy the bowls, so I'm going to try a refurbished one. I grind a lot of meat for my dogs, and need power to get the meat ground up, this works great. The company needs to correct the food or gook that gets into the handle, and also to correct the way the way the rubber gasket in the lids corrode. This is impossible to correct by the customer. Don't think the blender will last forever for those reasons.

Author: Christina
Title: Exactly what I needed in my kitchen!
Body: We make smoothies almost every day. This makes that so easy and fast! Clean up is a breeze. The recipe book has some great ideas, too. I made the ice cream and it was a crowd pleaser.

Author: Jessica Solano

Body: best blender i have ever owned! blends amazing and mixes up all my veggies and fruits for smoothies! definitely recommend this.

Title: has a lot of power plastic is a bit cheap ...

Author: NayNay
Title: Great product
Body: This blender is great! I got it because my old one died, I had a different brand just a generic blender and always had problems with the blade not chopping up everything (I had to do a lot of stirring).The blades on this Ninja are not just at the bottom but are spaced out so that the too and middle get blended as well and no stirring is required.I have yet to try out the single cup blender cups that came with it, though the idea is genius. I would have used it a ton but the tops that come with it aren’t spill proof, I’ll have to search to see if spill-proof ones are sold.

Author: Kimberly
Title: Five Stars
Body: Finally I get something really good by amazon! I totally recommend it! I'm in love with this blender!

Author: CS from NJ
Title: The blades are super sharp!
Body: After doing much research I decided to order this model in NEW CONDITIONl. When I received it appeared as if it was not brand new but not used. Therefore, I decided to return it for an even exchange. I did call the manufacturer to ask their opinion. They agreed it might have been returned.The 2nd one I ordered came in a brown Ninja box not in an original colored box the other one came in. I'm confused as to how these are shipped, where they are shipped from and something does not seem right. I did not want to go through the hassle of returning it because I have been anxious in beginning to make smoothies.As I began to carefully wash the single serve blade, I did get a small scrape cut on my middle finger even though I read reviews which showed other people getting cut. I should have used a long thin brush. The blades are super sharp!!!I can't rate the quality but I made 3 smoothies so far and they were all NOT smooth as other reviewers stated.If I buy a product, I want it to be sealed in an original packaging not sent in a brown box!Is anyone with knowledge in how these are shipped going to give me an answer?

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Blender works great. Cups are a bit small, but still work great too

Author: Cher
Title: Five Stars
Body: Absolutely love this blender. It makes everything I have thrown at it.

Author: CAT
Title: Not for Mexican type salsa's!!!
Body: Nice and powerful blender for most of your blender needs. If you are a Mexican salsa maker do not get this brand. It does not blend the Mexican type salsa well. It leaves most of the seeds intact. Otherwise it's great for everything else.

Author: Grumpy old guy
Title: The poor old thing was so worn out we were making ...
Body: We upgraded from a 1980's era Oster blender that has served us well over the years. Alas, it was time to retire it. The poor old thing was so worn out we were making roughies instead of smoothines! No more. With the Ninja, and the single serving attachment, it's smoothie-ville from here on out! Great product, great price.

Author: Michael R.
Title: These have a poor design where blender meets base
Body: These have a poor design where blender meets base. The fins are plastic cover steel that the plastic desinegrates and it becomes useless. I replaced single serve unit three times, (really expensive). I don't think I ever got more than 50 uses. Now the plastic has come off base and won't engage at all. They offered me replacement parts for more than buying a new unit. I will never buy one of their products again.

Author: CJR
Title: Jar broke within a week of daily use
Body: I didn't expect Blendtech/Vitamix quality for the price point, but I also didn't expect for the jar to break within a week. The bottom portion of the jar shattered. Although it was still usable with the cracks in it, it doesn't give me too much faith in the longevity of the blender. I returned it and will be putting my money towards a better blender with a warranty.

Author: Steven
Title: Five Stars
Body: It’s great!

Body: Hate it. Single serve is a big mess. Stuff leaks out. Have to clean it every time. Negates the convenience of a blender. In general it always leaves ice chunks.

Title: Loved the unit till the pitcher cracked at 8 months ...
Body: Loved the unit till the pitcher cracked at 8 months of ownership. Called to get it replaced and was told the pitcher is not covered under warranty. They then told me the jaw dropping price of 65 dollars for the pitcher, and just the pitcher. Last product of theirs that I will ever buy. Be warned. The components are cheap plastic and will eventually crack. Base is solid and now makes a great paperweight.

Author: Katie L.

Body: I use this thing every day to make smoothies and sauces. It’s powerful and easy to use. I am a little disappointed that the painted marking arrows to align blender with the lid are washing off the handle and the lid, with hand wash only. I’ve had the product for about 8 months.

Body: I absolutely LOVE this blender. It comes with the large blender and then 2 small blender cups. My son makes slushies all the time in the small blender cups. I use the big blender for smoothies, soups and salad dressings. The blades are sharp and cut thru ice and frozen fruit. Definitely does the job of big industrial blenders but doesn't cost as much.

Author: Karen S.

Title: ... Ninja for a few months now and it is amazing. It makes the best smoothies and sauces and ...
Body: I have been using this Ninja for a few months now and it is amazing. It makes the best smoothies and sauces and the clean up is effortless - as long as you don't let it sit. It's nice knowing exactly what is in my smoothies! Very happy with this purchase.

Author: CC
Title: Broke in less than 5 months and warranty replacement costs $20!
Body: I bought my Shark blender in November 2017 to make smoothies. It was powerful and worked well until March 2018 when the bottom unit started smoking and it stopped working. I called Shark to get a replacement under its1-year warranty but the rep informed me that it would cost $20 to send a replacement. It feels unfair to charge me $20 for their defective product. I would not buy another Shark product again.

Title: Doesn’t blend seeds and thick fiber well.
Body: For the most part it blends well. Doesn’t blend it 100% though. Around 80-85% of the stuff is blended. Can feel slight pieces or chunks of vegetables such as strawberries, celery, and other things with thick fiber. Also doesn’t blend seeds well. I’ll give nutribullet a try next. But besides these things, it’s not so bad.

Author: R3cKlEsS Carlito
Title: Five Stars

Author: Melissa Wicks

Author: Crystal
Title: Five Stars

Author: Amy J
Title: Five Stars

Author: Amanda O
Title: Blends ice very easily and gets that perfect professional texture
Body: We wanted a blender that could save us money on fancy smoothies and we got it! Blends ice very easily and gets that perfect professional texture.

Author: Darren O'Hooligan
Title: Amazing blender for shakes and smoothies
Body: MY blender was pushing 17 years old and I decided to start a smoothie kick. The old one wasn't doing it. This one is a BEAST. Opened it up, put it together and at first it wouldn't blend or chop my frozen fruits. Added lots of almond milk, and it came out OK. The next morning I thawed fruit, and OMG what a difference. Within seconds I had an amazing berry banana smoothie. Apparently It destroys ice like it's nothing.. can't wait for the summer to make some snow cones!! This thing is a beast if you plan on making smoothies or shakes for healthy living. Remember, use thawed or fresh fruit and add ice if needed.

Author: blueangel11
Title: Four Stars
Body: Not as powerfully as I expected but I love the small containers to make shakes

Author: cali
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great blender, well thought out.

Author: Cyclonus
Title: Great Product
Body: Great Product

Author: Brian P
Title: Smoothies in Seconds
Body: We love our Ninja! It's so easy to make a large container of smoothy and switch over to make a personal size one. Hard to make thick or chunky salsa though, but may just need to practice more. One note... careful cleaning the blades. They are extremely sharp, as expected.

Author: ANTHONY DANTZLER
Title: Great product. Use it daily
Body: Quick delivery. Great product. Use it daily.

Author: Jay
Title: Purchased this prior to the holiday and started using end ...
Body: Purchased this prior to the holiday and started using end of January. By end of February the container was cracked and leaking liquids after minimal use.

Author: yjavaux713
Title: works great
Body: Love this Ninja. Great for individual smoothies or a large pitcher.

Author: Margarita S
Title: Love it!
Body: I love my Ninja! With Mexican cooking, considering all of the chiles we use, it blended everything to perfection!The smaller travel cups are perfect for smoothies.

Author: JP
Title: Love It
Body: This product is great. Works as expected and recommend this product to anyone.

Author: Lula
Title: Five Stars
Body: Is very good

Author: Huapango
Title: Be aware of low quality and very expensive replacement parts.
Body: I got a Ninja blender about two years ago because of all these good reviews but I was really dissapointed. To begin with, I didn’t liked the fact that it is hard to clean and puting the lid on and off is a pain in the butt. However I got used to it and dealt with the cleaning part. Then about a month after the warranty expired the plastic pitcher cracked so I had to replaced the part which cost me $84 including shipment. It was expensive for a plastic pitcher but still cheaper than buying a new blender since I already had the motor. So, spending another $125 didn’t make much sense... until today. This morning the second pitcher cracked while I was making a banana milk shake! Seriously? It is not that I’m crushing rocks in it! I hadn’t even put the ice in it! so really there’s no reason for it to have cracked other than regular use. Why am I keeping this blender? I think I just didn’t want to accept I made a mistake by purchasing something that looks good in my kitchen but it is not durable enough and doesn’t give me the service I need from a good blender. I learned my lesson the hard way. No more Ninja products for me, no matter how cool the name sounds.

Author: Chris D
Title: Best I've found
Body: The last one I had lasted 4 years with everyday use. It finally started making some noise like it was loose inside and quit working so I got this mostly for the power head. Its strong and not too expensive for the service we get out of it.

Author: Lavinya
Title: Five Stars

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Does not work in Israel... Should mention ...

Author: Kj
Title: Five Stars

Author: Carolyn Macky
Title: Made from cheap materials.
Body: Although I've had this blender for about 4 years, I haven't used it a lot. I use the large blender once a year at Thanksgiving, but I like having the individual drink mixers to make smoothies and mixed drinks. Now the blender won't work with the individual drink containers. Everything looks normal, but when I put the container in the blender and turn on the power, the power button just flashes and nothing moves or makes a sound. The large blender container still works, but I don't want to have to use that every time I want to make a smoothie. Also, the lid on the large container has always been difficult to get off and on. If you don't handle it just right, it comes apart. The little tabs that hold the lid on the container are very fragile, made of cheap plastic that looks like it will break. I've been very disappointed with this blender; for something that had such a high rating, I thought it should last longer, especially since I haven't used it much.

Author: Jessica
Title: Super disappointed to spend this kind of money to have ...
Body: Bought this on Black Friday as a Christmas gift...only used it once. And now there’s several cracks in the bottom of the blender??? Sure hope I can get ahold of someone to make this right. Super disappointed to spend this kind of money to have it break after one use.

Author: Nikkalee
Title: Easy to clean
Body: Petfect unit. Easy to clean. Does awesome job for smoothies and drinks.

Author: Mac User
Title: Who needs a Vita-Mix???
Body: Love this blender! Plenty of power and I really love the individual serving blender containers, which are great for breakfast smoothies on the go!

Author: S. Arthur
Title: Blends super well, we'll see if it holds up...
Body: Works great so far and no complaints. The materials are plastic all around, so I'm a little wary that after repeated dishwashings stuff will stop sealing, little tabs will break off, etc. I'm especially concerned about the little anchoring mechanism that you use with the single-serve cups, but again, it has worked great thus far. We'll see how it goes and I'll post back here...

Author: Damien
Title: I mean it blends like it should
Body: This thing is cheap as hell. I mean it blends like it should, but I ordered refurbish and it had so many scratches on the metal and plastics, and really all over the cups. Also, the description really did not go into detail how lacking this model is compared to LITERALLY any other Nina model. I mean heck if I knew it only has like 4 modes, I'd just thrown in the extra $20 and bought a model with more functions.Oh and, the cups do not have a seal. Like, seriously, nobody thought, Hey, maybe they would like to just store these cups in the fridge for once?. THERE IS A HOLE IN THE DAMN CUP. It is literally a cup to go, as in, you have to drink it right after you blend it, because there is no way to seal the contents inside. Oh and good luck trying to find a different type of seal to replace the one it comes with, because there are none for that specific cup size.Oh but wait! Other models offer bigger cups that also have a seal! Why not use those? WELL YOU CAN'T. Because the cups for this model are specific to just this model. As in, no other seal, or cup size will work with the blender. And, by the way, Ninja does not sell any other cup seal or type other than what is pictured for this model.Never again will I take Amazon's Recommended Products as an honest recommendation.

Author: Lisa S
Title: This thing rocks!!
Body: I am not a breakfast eater but need something before work. I like Andrew Lessman Secure with Almond Milk (the healthiest thing I will have all day). When I would stir with a spoon (I like it to taste like chocolate milk), there would always be some little chunks on top. I bought this blender with that in mind and maybe to mix with ice. I washed it and tested it out the night before work. It is very LOUD. I have neighbors and didn’t want to wake up their dog and 4 am (I wouldn’t vacuum at this hour either for the same reason). I premix it the night before and put in the fridge. It is still perfectly mixed in the morning when I wake up. Problem solved. The lid locks in place (pitcher) - very important safety feature. The two cups that come with it are great for single serve. My recommendation to the manufacturer would be to add 2 lids that do not have an opening (to drink from) so that you can mix and put in the fridge for later without spilling - you can switch lids when you are ready to drink it.

Author: Aggie
Title: Five Stars
Body: Powerful smoothie maker in the house now!

Author: Bunny
Title: This has changed my life!!!
Body: God forbid there's a fire but after my dogs I'd try to save the blender. I use it every morning with those little cups, it's fantastic. It suction-cups itself to the counter too. It's incredible.

Title: Great blender!
Body: This is a great blender! It's powerful and can crush ice perfectly in case you want to make some wonderful yummy frozen margaritas :-) The go-cups are fantastic for when you want to make a quick smoothie to go or if you only want to make enough for one person. The lids don't leak so you can just throw them in your bag without worrying about any mess. The blades are very sharp so do be careful while cleaning. Also the cup lids are best cleaned if you soak them or use a brush to get the hard to reach corners. Overall this was a great buy!

Body: Overall, this is a good quality blender. I've had mine for over a year and use it several times a week. If you're looking for a blender for basic smoothies this is perfect. However, it doesn't do well with making frozen desserts, such as sorbets smoothie bowls. Additionally, this would not be good for making pastes like nut butters. The downfalls are attributed to the blade design/positioning.

Unfortunately with other blenders I’ve had lumpy funny tasting smoothies. But not anymore! This has been hands down my favorite blender! Blends quickly, smoothly/evenly, and my favorite; this thing could NOT be easier to clean! Everything comes out and apart, thus making it impossible for you to have a funky tasting-and smelling- drink. If you’re in the market looking at vitamix and blendtec but hate the price-like I did- this is a great alternative!

Title: Have not used as yet but seemed like a good product
Body: Have not used as yet but seemed like a good product.However, I did not like that it did not come in packaging and that it was left outside my door in an obvious place where someone could have taken it. The fact that it came in the original box did not help either, anyone could see what it was. In addition the box was very damaged, as if someone was playing football with it. Poor care and concern for product. I hope it does work, otherwise I will have to return and I will let you know how that goes.Also, I thought that the blender would be able to fit the 24 or 32 oz cups to blend so that I would not have to use the 72 oz blender but it does not. I previously had another version of Ninja blender with the 24 oz metal cup. I gave away the blender but kept the 24 oz cup hoping to use in this new Ninja professional blender but unfortunately not going to work.

Body: I make lots of smoothies, and my $20 target specials kept burning out or breaking. Man this thing has some power, it eats all! It is pretty noisy, not recommended for use when wife is sleeping.

Author: marie marsh
Title: Five Stars

Author: Jessica
Title: Five Stars
Body: LOVE THIS BLENDER!!!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Better than the average blender
Body: Took advantage of the sale a few months ago when it was almost half of what it cost now. Although I have issues with the bigger mixing blender, the cups work perfectly. I think I have a defect on the big blender but working to get it replaced. Overall, I'm still happy. Still get to have my smoothies everyday, but can only make one at a time until I get another the bigger one replaced/fixed.

Author: The Wild one
Title: Vita Prep vs Ninja Pro: Raw Fruit & Veggie Smoothie Comparison
Body: I had a Vita Prep that recently broke (my fault) & decided to buy a Ninja since the reviews were so great. I don't use my blender for making soups or milling flour or making butters or anything fancy. I use my blender on a daily basis to make a smoothie that consists of various raw berries & raw veggies. I can tell you I was excited to not have to use a tamper anymore but was underwhelmed by the results. It does not blend the blackberry & raspberry seeds very well nor does it blend raw broccoli very well (the little nubs on the florets are practically left whole even though I allow it to blend on high for a longer time than I did on my Vita Prep). My smoothie just doesn't come out very smooth with the Ninja & I have to chew my smoothie before I can swallow it. I'd say the Ninja works better as a food processor rather than a blender because the results are fairly lumpy & not smooth. I will be returning Ninja Pro & giving the Ninja Chef a try next. I hope that one produces smoother results as I really don't want to spend $300 or more on a blender just so that I can get a decent smoothie.

Author: Mother Goose
Title: Awesome
Body: This is awesome and super high power. Amazingly sharp blades. Be very careful washing them!

Author: eva s.
Title: Five Stars
Body: I love it! Very convenient and efficient

Author: Kim South Stone
Title: Five Stars
Body: I am very satisfied with this blender.Good machine.

Author: JOSE
Title: Five Stars
Body: Easy to clean.Strong motor.But be careful with the blades, they're very sharp.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Overall disappointed.
Body: The blades for the big blender are a pain to clean, and the small blades for the individual servings is already cracked and causing leaks. Pretty disappointing considering how much I paid. I use my 1 2 3 times everyday so I need it to be reliable. Also, I run into random bigger ice chunks when I do use the bigger blender.

Author: C. Gallagher
Title: A great addition to the kitchen.
Body: I especially love having the single-serve inserts so that you can make smoothies without lots of cleanup. A very useful tool! I bought it to be a little more creative in the kitchen without spending 1/2 my time with cleanup after. Quality product.

Author: Will Strong
Title: Powerful, quality blender with a big flaw
Body: I like the product. It is a generally well-designed blender a powerful motor. I've only had it a short while, so I can't attest to its durability, but out of the box I am impressed.So why only three stars?I wanted to give it four, but the lid leaks. I am using it to make liposomal vitamin C, which is a viscous fluid (it has oil in it). The blender throws the liquid against the top so forcefully (it has a powerful motor), that it pushes it against the spout cover, where it comes dribbling out and runs down the side of the blender, where I have to clean it. I am only mixing less than 1000 ml of liquid--and it gets less due to leakage every time I blend it , which is six times in a day. Even when I push down hard on the spout cover it comes out. I don't know yet if this happens with all liquids, as I've only used it for the liposomal C so far.I'm going to eventually find a workaround, but I shouldn't have to, thus--three stars.Also (this is not a flaw), be CAREFUL. The blades are razor sharp. I sliced my thumb open on them.

Author: Ngeorge
Title: Lives up to the Ninja hype!
Body: This professional grade blender is excellent. It performs all tasks quickly and well.

Author: Amner
Title: Greatest ninja blender
Body: Works wonders on drinks. We couldnt stop using it. My girlfriend loves it. Makrs a good healthy drink in seconds.

Author: Paula_B
Title: Nice blender but single serve cups too small
Body: I love this blender, which I got for Christmas about a month ago. But, I'm finding that the single serve cups are too small (16 oz) for the smoothies I like to make. Once I add about a cup to a cup and a quarter of liquid, then a cup or so of fruit, that comes just over the max fill line and it's difficult to get the blades on. My fault, I probably should have done more research. As far as I can tell, no other size cups will fit this model. I'm now looking at the Nutri Ninja, which comes with larger cups. If I get that, this blender will go on a shelf and I'll save it for blending larger portions, using the large blender container. Kind of disappointing that they don't make larger cups for this one.

If you are wanting to buy a quality appliancethat is both powerful and versatile, the Ninja Pro Blender is exactlywhat you are looking for!

Author: dan
Title: Should've bought it years ago.
Body: Pardon my language but this thing is bad ass! If you have never seen one in action. I can't describe it to you. Should've bought one years ago.

Author: Flavio Alves
Title: Five Stars
Body: My boeno

Author: rapid1
Title: Five Stars
Body: grabbed on black friday works great

Author: Brooke
Title: Great value
Body: The value to price cannot be beat. Well...probably. I did a medium amount of research to be clear...Works great, even on ice. We get the most use out of the single serve cups, but I like not being beholden to using only those. I LIKE MY OPTIONS OKAY.My advice for garbage people: if you're not going to wash the cups right away (I can't be the only one), at least unscrew the lid. When that banana smoothie goes rock hard from neglect, it is near impossible to dislodge the cap even with a revenge death grip.

Body: I Love This Blender! My life is now complete. My bucket list is irrelevant now that I have this blender. The smoothies, the margaritas, the pina coladas! All delicious! Seriously though, this is the vest blender I have ever had and I can’t ever see myself buying any other brand. Get this blender!

Author: Saturday Club House Support Team
Title: Five Stars
Body: this was a gift last christmas and she was please on the product

Author: Slanger
Title: Daquaries mixed in 10 seconds or less.
Body: We replaced an old standard blender with this product. It is certainly powerful enough. the blade configuration made short order of crushing ice for ice drinks as well as blending ice-cream for grasshoppers. Be careful when you open it and tip it to pour, the blade for the large mixer container is not held in at the bottom so it can slide out. There are multiple blades on the center piece so it is not as easy to stir things in process like you could with a standard blender. You can't do it while it is running and the blades are in the way while it is stopped. The smaller containers like for individual drinks are of a standard configuration.

Author: A. Reiheld
Title: Very good quality blender
Body: A good splurge.. It has the power to chop ice quickly and uniformly for margaritas, makes a fine smoothie or milkshake, emulsifies homemade salad dressing. Does everything I ask of it. No more $29 disappointments.

Author: amadama
Title: Well Blended
Body: I bought this as a gift, and I have one of my own. These are great little blenders. Very powerful, and great for milkshakes and smoothies. Love mine, and they loved the one I got as a gift.

Author: Camojeff
Title: Five Stars

Author: Cindy Schoultz
Title: Five Stars

Author: DEBBIE m
Title: very strong
Body: This blender is one of the best blenders i have ever bought!!! This is the 4th one{only one NINJA} and by far the best

Author: Nkrumma C Lindsay
Title: Yes it will blend
Body: This blender is awesome. I tend to drink pretty heavy shakes, with 2-3 scoops of protein powder, oats, peanut butter, frozen fruit, and sometimes honey. This makes for a VERY thicc shake. The Ninja handles it with ease!The only thing I find lacking is the size of the Nutri Ninja cups.It would be nice if it was just a little bigger, or they had a couple different sizes so I could add some more water. However, to my amazement, the blender still handles the same amount of dry ingredients with less water added than other blenders, so it ends up not being an issue.

Author: Rimon
Title: Five Stars
Body: I bought this for my wife who loves it.

Author: A. Lucia
Title: Mixes Everything Well
Body: This mixes up my smoothies and shakes much better than other products I've used. The blade in the blender mixes up EVERYTHING. I'm very happy I purchased it!

Author: November Raine
Title: Wicked blender
Body: I love the Ninja brand! This one did not disappoint. It’s a wicked blender and it’s realtively easy to clean.

Author: Johnny G
Title: Five Stars
Body: Amazing product does everything the new one does!

Author: H Tyson
Title: 16oz Cups are way to small for large shakes! Good blender, but that's a flaw!
Body: I like this Blender but the BL660 has one Major Flaw! You can't buy any cups bigger then the 16oz that come with it! I like to add a lot of ice to my home made protein shakes, and that's where the 1st star came off. Id give it a 3 1/2 if it let me! If your a bodybuilder or someone looking to make & go I'd look for another option. Well it does have the big pour blender, but it still doesn't fit into the 16oz cups.

Author: Xinshan Bai
Title: Five Stars
Body: Works perfectly for homemaking smoothie, but please don't expect this will beat $300 products.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: My dream blender
Body: OMG I’ve always wanted a Ninja ever since I was in college. I’m a gym rat and love smoothies after my workouts or beforehand for breakfast before my afternoon workouts. I used to have an Oster blender as a broke college student but it was so big, hard to clean and super loud.I saw this on sale for Black Friday and instantly bought it! It’s easy to clean. Has two separate cups to use for traveling. I don’t really use the big huge one since I only blend in the house. So I use the personal cup one and it’s so great. I don’t have to worry about making too much and wasting food. It also isn’t super loud. I can also easily chop ice. I had the hardest time with my last blender because I’d have to stop and clear the blades and the ice would just melt in that time lol (so annoying) but the Ninja does it effortlessly. I can blend while my newborn and toddler are sleeping which is great! It’s easy to store and I don’t have to hold the cup down to blend it’s so awesome. I highly recommend this to everyone!

Author: Jimmy
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love this blender!!!

Author: DYIgirlNY
Title: Love it!
Body: Love this! Very powerful and fast, especially for making smoothies in the morning. Easy to use!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Excellent product corresponded to the description

Author: Suzanne Utt
Title: Works great and smoothies and protein shakes are so easy
Body: Works great and smoothies and protein shakes are so easy. The inside blades come out and they wash easily. Lots of power and the ice doesn't bog the motor down at all. Will use all summer poolside.

Author: Chrys Mohr
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great item

Author: Robert C Vinson
Title: Great thing to have to be healthy
Body: Great price and great product

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: These are definitely worth the price.

Author: JP
Title: Products break after 6 weeks.
Body: Very disappointed. I've been using this for 6 weeks. Now the pour lid does not stay closed and liquid comes out while it's working. Also, when I pour the liquid into a glass liquid comes out from the entire lid and spills everywhere. The rubber seals no longer work. I looked at replacement lids and they all get poor ratings for not fitting or breaking quickly. I'll never buy a Ninja again. The warranty is useless because it cost more to ship the unit back to them than to replace it. You also have to send them money to ship the warranty replacement product back to you!

Body: I was using it 4th time and jar broke. Was following standard orange smoothie recipe and after pressing pulse for 2-3 seconds 2 times, there was hole in jar. Luckily I am safe. Will try to contact amazon / ninja to replace or return this item.

Author: Greg T.
Title: Low-quality Junk, and Ninja does not stand behind it.
Body: The pitcher developed huge cracks around the bottom within a month of daily use. I contacted Ninja and they told me that while this was not covered under their warranty they would send me a replacement just this once. Replacement arrived and within a month it too developed the cracks. This time Ninja said I would have to buy a replacement pitcher that ran about ~$70, and they would not replace it. Ninja make walmart quality junk, and they do not stand behind it. By my calculations, after 7 months of using this blender and buying a new pitcher every month you could have just bought a vitamix.

If you have housemates and plan on using this thing in the morning, then they will assuredly hate you. I live alone, so fortunately this isn't a problem for me currently.

Title: Easy to use
Body: Easy to use. Love having just three buttons. My old blender had about 24 buttons. And none of them seemed to do what I needed. Powerful. Blended my Carrot, Coconut, and Ginger soup in a jiffy. Love the individual serving cups. I might actually stick to my resolution to make more smoothies and up my fruits and veggies intake. I do wish the power cord was a little longer. I live in an old house with one power outlet at the center of the counter top wall. Awkward position for an appliance that I want to keep out year-round. If the cord was about 8 inches longer I could position it at the end of the counter.

Author: Joe
Title: I’m blown away at how crappy it is
Body: Really weak blender. I’m blown away at how crappy it is. I’ve been using the singleserve attachment and this thing can’t even cut kale up. The bullet I bought 8 years ago and just threw away when I got this was at least twice as efficient at blending. Very disappointed in this product On top of that I can’t even use the large blender because the blade on it looked like it had already been used. There was just coloration all over the plastic that holds the blades and small pieces of the plastic that we’re shedding off already. I called in and let the manufacturer know and they agreed to send a new blade but this thing still sucks. It goes light speed fast but can’t even cut up kale. LAME!!
