Author: Judith Elenore
Title: Great blender that has a long life!
Body: We have had our ninja for 2 years and still going strong! I am so glad that we purchased the set with the nutri ninja cups. They are invaluable when making smoothies. I use the cups for smoothies,salad dressings and making fresh bread crumbs. You must have enough liquid in the cups, or they will not blend well. So, the cups would not be ideal for hummus or dips. I use the large pitcher for smoothies or soups and it does a great job. I made fresh tomato sauce with it this summer and it was the smoothest I have ever made! I wash both cups and pitcher in the dish washer and they do great! The pitcher does have some small nooks that tend to catch food particles in the dish washer. But, they are on the underside and do not come into contact with the food surface.

Author: Alex
Title: Great Product
Body: I use this blender daily for my post workout smoothie.It works really great and i really love it.It has a very sharp blade. I read some people complaining about that blade. I honestly don't know why they are complaining because simply the blade was meant to cut through the toughest ingredians ( Which is what this blender for ) and obviously the blade should be ultra sharp which i find it a good thing.While washing it you should be extra careful not to cut yourself and that's it. You are supposed to be careful while washing any blades any way i don't see any reason to clarify thing about that sharp blade.The blending is strong. the Motor is Powerful. The Size of the Cup if Big and i like that.Never used the small serving yet.Overall Great Product.You need to know how exactly to use the blender as every speed it has gives different output and also continuous or pulsive blending is another factor you might consider.Trial and Error is always the best approach to exactly figure out the output of your mix.Overall i am satisfies with the product, I didn't actual use any other ones to compare. but this one do what i need to for me that's enough.

Title: Dishwasher safe? Not so much.
Body: We ordered this blender under the impression it was dishwasher safe. A few days into using it I noticed a crack had formed in the pitcher. I went on the Ninja website and they were nice enough to replace the pitcher for free after I told them it was cracked. The neglected to tell me that the pitcher isn't safe for newer dishwashers. I realized this myself of course after the brand new pitcher came out all cracked. They did tell me after we contacted them again but no replacement pitcher this time. I didn't think it was worth paying $65 on top of the $100 we paid for the month old blend itself so we're returning this item.

Author: Tony
Title: Plastic does not hold up over time
Body: I've had this blender for just over a year. It blends very well. I have been drinking Bullet Proof Coffee, and it requires that I use a high speed blender. When I blend my coffee in the single serve cups, upon removing the cups from the blender, more often than not, the lid will not stay secure and coffee spews all over the countertop. I have since stopped using the single serve cups for this reason. Now I use the full sized blender to make my coffee every morning. Over time, it began to leak because the bottom of the blender started to get small hairline cracks that have riddled the bottom of the pitcher. I repaired them until it became too much to repair. At that time, I bought a replacement pitcher. I used it exactly one time, and it already has a crack. This crack started on the bottom and now extends up the side. I guess I'm in the market for a blender that isn't made out of plastic.

Author: Matthew K. Wimmer
Title: A powerful blender at a reasonable price
Body: This blender is probably overkill for our infrequent use, but it's well made, well sealed and very powerful. It crushes a full pitcher of parrot kibble (we make our own bird food for our parrots using commercial pellets, fruits and vegetables and spices) without breaking a sweat. The multiple level blade makes short work of processing large quantities of material, and also helps avoid unwanted liquification at the bottom. Everything locks and seals together well and the parts are well designed to rinse clean easily. We haven't used the single-serve cups much, but they work as advertised and if we drank more smoothies we'd probably have more to say about them. This seems to be a good machine at a reasonable price.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great blender except the plastic flip lid over the pour ...
Body: Great blender except the plastic flip lid over the pour spot. Broke shortly after getting it. Other wise it works great. But the cups aren't great. and don't hold much as using them over agitates the contents and always makes a mess. Plus the seals wear out easily and quickly. Ended up just putting this one away unless we need to make something big and getting a Magic Bullet for the smaller drinks.

Author: Jupolo
Title: Great single serve, TERRIBLE main blender
Body: A little torn as to whether to give it 2 stars or 3. The single serve cups are great, blends kale stems and ice cubes down to nothing in seconds for my smoothies. You can just add your food, blend and drink - no pre-blending or stopping and starting needed, cleaning the single serve cups is also a snap. Top marks for the single serve cups, if that is all you care about and the price is right for you, you will not be disappointed.Now for the main blender... what were they thinking when they designed this! We tried to blend 1-2 cubed raw squash. It completely failed (ended up scraping it into the single serve cup where it worked fine). The main blender cup is square in cross section, but the blades spin in a circle, so there are big dead zones at the corners where large chunks of food hide. Next issue, the access hole in the lid is a small pour spout, too small to put anything in while blending. The lid itself holds the blades in, so it would be a huge safety hazard to take the lid off while the blender is on, so you can't add anything mid blend. The blades are a crazy design, there are 6 big blades at 3 different heights, all very sharp. Wife cut herself on it first time cleaning it. The blades are not angled like on every other blender ever made. This means that there is no vortex - this in turn means that food is not pulled down to the bottom of the blender where the blades should be. If it works at all, food is at best shredded, not blended. This blender might work well if you are blending wet foods, but otherwise this is TERRIBLE. Big disappointment. Bought the 25 dollar Epica as a replacement for smoothies, but found it lacked the needed power that the single serve Ninja cups certainly has.

This thing has been very easy to learn to use without wasting a lot of ingredients. Very forgiving, and makes it fun to experiment. I don't have to worry about the machine bogging down when I play around with new recipes.

Author: newbie
Title: Definitely no Vitamix. Does not blend smoothly.
Body: I always saw them as a cheaper version of the more expensive high end blenders. That is, until I actually used one. I was anti-Vitamix before, mainly due to the outrageous cost, but now I understand why there is a huge difference.Pros:-The motor is much more powerful than a standard blender.-Very quick blending due to the 3 bladesCons:-Cheaply made. For example, after only a few uses, the pour cap on the lid broke and falls off all the time. Also feels very cheap.-Messy/Difficult cleaning. As soon as you start this thing, the entire container and lid get plastered with whatever is in the blender. Sure, not the end of the world, but plan to spend more time cleaning. With my Vitamix, the container tends to not get dirty much above where you filled it, plus it is very easy to clean by simply blending soap and water.-3 blade assembly. The 3 blade assembly is very annoying. It makes it much more difficult to fill the blender. Also more difficult to clean, easy to cut yourself with and good luck replacing it if it is taken out when the blender isn't empty. You really don't want to be dealing with this thing. It is a pain.-My biggest problem with this blender-- It does not blend smoothly. If you try to blend anything that is rough, it will not fully blend. I added kale to my smoothie and instead of being blended in, my drink had finely chopped kale pieces in it even after blending for a fair amount of time. My Vitamix handles this no problem to a smooth creamy consistency where you would not even know there was kale added.If you want a good blender, save your money and get a refurb Vitamix or Blendtec.

Author: Ivan Baccarat
Title: Bad design
Body: This blender is poorly designed. First off the blades are overkill. There is no need for this many blades and they take up a lot of the inside of the blender. Secondly there are a lot of little things that are tremendously annoying. Like the suction cups on the bottom, you literally can't move it, slide it, or pick it up without disengaging them, thirdly you can't blend things without the lid being attached which is a pain in the ass in itself because unless everything is aligned just right you can't even just put the lid on. And you have to twist the blender into place each time you use it. Nor can you put things in the blender while it's blending because, again, it won't start unless the lid is clicked and locked into place. Also you have to take the blade assembly out each and every time you use it and because it's so big a lot of what you've blended is coating the assembly. I like to be able to dump stuff in as I'm blending and don't want to remove the blade assembly each and every time I blend something. I'm disappointed by this purchase...

Author: Blitz
Title: Five Stars
Body: Dunno why other blenders suck. But this is great!

Author: girlypants
Title: it makes shave ice! And makes the best smoothies.
Body: When my husband’s office shut down and moved they off loaded everything in the place. It was a sweet deal for us getting a ton of free stuff. One of the items happened to be a Ninja Blender. I know, who doesn’t bother to take a blender that is a beast home with them, well guess they didn’t see any value in the maybe used twice blender. I have two of the blenders single serve cups and this thing chews through ice like you have never seen. I tried it out with ice and fruit, worked instantly to break it down and a mix. Then I tried out the big blender container with ice in it. Its makes shave ice! Awesome! We also made a huge thing of Pina coladas and they came out just like the ones at resorts in Puerto Rico. I am in love with it so far. It now has a permanent spot on the counter since I seem to use it daily for shakes and for random food items. I will have to get my hands on a manual to see what else this baby can do.

Author: D.A.
Title: Height + suction cups really sucks for me
Body: Our old 30$ Oster blender gave out.. I really hated that blender and was excited it finally stopped working :-) It was super loud, didn't blend anything unless there was a crazy amount of liquid and even then I had to smack the side with it running to get things mixed right.Anyway I started looking for a replacement. Not impressed with this Ninja. Many reviewers said the suction cups are annoying but I ordered anyways. I put it on the on the counter under the cabinets, with the lid on and tested getting it out for use and putting back. It doesn't slide at all. In fact it so tall there isn't enough clearance to tilt and easily break the suction. I proceeded to re-box and didn't even turn it on. I re-read reviews and found recommendations to use a pot holder or paper towel under the unit.. ridiculous. If it moves that much the base should be heavier, even at this price range I feel.Like some reviewers I'm suspicious that this brand is over hyped but I returned for replacement with the Nutri Ninja Auto-iQ Compact System (BL492) unit because I really want to like the Ninja to replace a blender + magic bullet type. . If that doesn't work out I am looking at the: Oster Pro 1200 Blender Plus 24 oz Smoothie Cup.It's fine for lots of folks, especially if you have higher that standard (17?) but the height + suction was a deal killer for me

Author: elaine Savige
Title: I was surprised and disappointed when it wouldn't turn on at all
Body: I bought this in August 2016 and only have used the small smaller individual cups. This week (Nov 12th) decided to make a larger blended mixture.I was surprised and disappointed when it wouldn't turn on at all. I plan ( at this point ) to try and return it. I did like the individual cups and will replace this item with another brand.

Author: Justin Darnell
Title: Ninja Professional Blender (BL660)
Body: Great for making Super Foods. Combining your favorite fruits and veggies topped off with organic honey. Grind it up... Add Ice... Grind it up. You have yourself a Super Smoothie! Great Product. Thanks! A+

Author: Angelene
Title: Five Stars
Body: The Ninja Professional Blender is freaking awesome! So happy that I finally bought one.

Author: The Hobyist
Title: Ninja Professional Blender works well
Body: I have been using the Ninja Professional Blender for about 3 months now. It does a much better job of chopping/mixing the fruit and such in my smoothies than my older standard blender. I like that I can use the smaller glass size container with the blender attachment for just one smoothie, or the bigger pitcher with the multi blade center piece to make smoothies for my husband and kids as well. I will caution that inside the glass size container blender attachment is a rubber washer that you will need to take out to wash & dry. I didn't realize this at first, so it got dark spots - maybe mold? - on it. When I realized the washer was in there, I took it out and soaked it in a bleach water mix, then washed again with soapy water. It seems to be fine. But, I would have liked to know in advance that the washer was in there, and how to easily take it out - because it is difficult to remove. Other than that, I am enjoying making smoothies with my Ninja!

Author: Rhotasha Jeter
Title: Love it. I dont regret this purchase
Body: Love it. I dont regret this purchase

Author: MP
Title: Quality Blender at a Great Price!
Body: Pros: Easy to use, great for on the go, blends incredibly fastCons: A little on the loud sideBottom Line: This is a great blender, especially if you are wanting to make a quick smoothie on the go.When my husband and I moved into our first apartment 14 years ago my mother-in-law brought us a blender as a house warming gift. It worked fine to make smoothies if we did not use frozen fruit, in that case we would blend...mix everything around with a wooden spoon…blend more...mix more…repeat. It would take up to five minutes to make a smoothie. We held onto that blender for 14 years, maybe because it was a gift, or maybe because of nostalgia. This year though we decided it was time for an upgrade. After quite a bit of research and asking for recommendations we decided to buy the Ninja Professional Blender (BL600). This blender has changed the way we eat and has made us wonder why we waited so long to upgrade. It is so easy and safe to use that our kids use it to make themselves smoothies. It is fast and makes single serve smoothies that are perfect when we are running late trying to get out the door to work. I recommend this blender to anyone looking to make smoothies, especially ones on the go.Blending Speed:This blender has three speeds plus one just for the single serve. It is simple and makes it easy to use. I can load the blender up with frozen fruit, almond milk, chia seeds, and spinach, and have an amazingly delicious smoothie in 30 seconds or less.Smooth Action:When reading through reviews for this blender there was some mention of it not doing a good enough job making a smooth blend, but rather leaving chunks and grains. We use this blender regularly and fill it with a lot of frozen fruit and grainy protein powder and seeds and have yet to experience this issue. All our smoothies come out perfectly smooth.Safety:From the rubber grips on the bottom that make it secure to the counter, to the safety lock on the lid that does not allow the blender to start without being secured; this blender is safe and reassuring for those with young kids wanting to help in the kitchen. I give this an A+ for safety which is high up on my importance list since our four-year-old daughter loves being involved with anything related to the kitchen and helping.Ease of Cleaning:What makes the blender so easy to clean in comparison to some of the others is that the blade has an easy to grab rubber grip above it that makes it easy to remove before cleaning. All the pieces to the machine come apart easily making cleaning quick and painless.Options:The two-single serve to-go style cups with lids was the cherry on the top for us. My husband and I both like to make smoothies in the morning, but have very different tastes. Not only do we each get to fill our own single serve cup up with our individual preferred ingredients, but we save dishes by just taking that cup to go rather than using a blender and then pouring it into to-go cups. Bonus: the single serve cups are also easy to clean.Noise Factor:The noise level on this blender is the one complaint I have. It is expected that a blender will not be silent, but this one is a little louder than I had expected. It is not a make or break deal for us, but we wait until nap time is over to make smoothies in our house.Cost:We paid $99.99 for our Ninja Professional Blender which was about mid-range in comparison to the other blenders we considered buying. We have used my mother-in-law’s Magic Bullet which she paid a little more for, but in my opinion makes about the same quality smoothie. $99.99 seems like a reasonable price for something we make so much use of.

Author: Margot H
Title: good for ice and smoothies but has trouble getting rid ...
Body: Powerful blender, good for ice and smoothies but has trouble getting rid of small particles. I was hoping to use it to mill flax seed etc but 10 min in the blender produces little effect. My last blender had a bullet attachment which powdered them very quickly - do not expect this with the Ninja.Another issue is cleaning - it may be dishwasher safe but I do not recommend putting it in the dishwasher, because the bottom attachments and the handle fill up inside with food gunk and it's really hard to get it out.Overall it's fine for now, the motor is solid quality and I use it every day, but has some design flaws and limitations.

Author: Dan
Title: OH THE NOISE, NOISE, NOISE!
Body: This thing can froth water but it should be sold with ear protection. the noise this thing makes is damaging to the human ear. I use ear plugs and or ear protection in the form of hunting ear protection. DO NOT USE THIS WITHOUT EAR PROTECTION! I have had it now for a couple of years and the single glass attachment is the second problem with this machine they are hard to line up and if you don't get it right it pours out all over. when you do get it on it takes two of you to get the lids off to wash them. The suction feet on my machine have never worked so I really can't say much about them. But on a up note the blender and food processor work great as long as you plug your ears.

The packaging CLEARLY states the blades are sharp as razors and just sit in there. So leave the top on or remove the blades before pouring. Geeze. Rather obvious. Otherwise, its a great blender. Blends everything I have put in it and fast too. Suction cups to the countertop. It will in the cabinet too so I store it on a plastic bag so it won't stick. Easy to clean, but again, the blades are as sharp as razors so be careful.

Title: Doesn't Achieve Smooth Texture, Loud, But Otherwise Good
Body: After using this for two years I've concluded that this blender is OK for the price. Its better than most blenders. For the majority of uses it does the trick, but I usually have 1-2 protein shakes a day and I end up having to chew them (which is actually good for your digestion, but at the same time its just not appealing). I'm not sure why, but I don't get a smooth liquidy texture no matter what I do. I always have granules of kale, cocoa nibs, almonds, etc left over. This blender is also really really loud.

Author: r
Title: Don't do it!
Body: Just forget all about the Ninja and put your money towards a VItamix. I sure wish I had done that, because not only is this not an amazing blender out of the box, the single-serve one wears out within a year, and the main one poops out within two.It just doesn't fully blend up a green smoothie, it leaves it really, really chunky. I wish I had just bitten the so-called bullet and gone for the real deal with a VItamix.To top it off it's a huge pain in the neck to clean.

Author: S.D.
Title: Get your daily smoothie fix.
Body: Really like the multiple blades. It chops up fruit and ice like nothing I've had before. I really like the two single-serve cups for when a small batch is just fine. It's also useful to prevent cross-contamination of ingredients (think food allergies). The blender sits quite secure on our counter because of the suction cups, but they may not work on granite counters. If that's the case, you'll likely want to hold it because it vibrates enough that a full pitcher could tip over.The lid of the big pitcher only fits one way and it locks in place. There is a pop-top on the lid so you can pour out the contents without accidentally dumping the blades out on your counter.The only down side to this blender is that the pitcher is made of plastic. I prefer the feel and durability of glass. My first one of these came with a broken pitcher. The box itself was not damaged, so I suspect it was broken at the factory. The replacement, however, has been flawless.

It's been 3 months, the pitcher is mysteriously on back-order. The award winning customer service has not been helpful at all. Don't be fooled! Avoid!
